loans.use: Purchasing seeds, fertilizer and cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Together As One Group

texts.en:
Paul D., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'Together As One'.  He is 42 years old, married, and has three children who are between the ages of 5 and 19 years old. He was only able to attend school through 12th grade due to financial constraints. 

For 22 years, he has been selling radios and watches in Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 16,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 90,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more radios and watches. 

He describes himself as a hard-working man whose goals are to improve his business and build a house.

loans.use: To buy more radios and watches

loans.name: Riski

texts.en:
Riski is a divorced mother who, since she took sole responsibility for raising her young children, has labored tirelessly to provide for all their needs. It was because of her strong work ethic that she found stable employment 10 years ago in cattle and sheep breeding. Things have slowly improved, but she would like to make further progress. Riski is requesting a loan of 7000 Somoni to improve the installations used to raise animals and provide an environment where she can increase their numbers and improve their living conditions. Let's help make Riski's hard work pay off so that her family can enjoy a better quality of life! 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. loans.use: Purchasing calves in order to expand the business

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with a grown daughter. She is an entrepreneur from Melitopol where she runs a small venture selling men’s upper clothing in one of the local markets. All her merchandise is characterized by high quality and reasonable price. Two of the best attractions of her business are affordable rent and favorable location. 

Yelena is a workaholic. She works in the worst weather conditions and is ready to sacrifice time and rest to achieve even higher results. She has been in this trade for 13 years. Currently, her gross income is about 30,000 Grivnyas. Her monthly net profit amounts to 9,000 Grivnyas.  

Yelena has benefited from previous lending assistance. Now she is hoping to receive a loan of 16,000 Grivnyas to purchase additional merchandise for her kiosk. Yelena is very customer-friendly. She is also very prompt with payments. This timely financial support will be crucial for her as her small venture is main source of income for her and her family.

loans.use: to increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya is married with two daughters. She is an entrepreneur from the small town of Korolyovo, Western Ukraine. Nataliya sells bakery goods, pastries and candy in the central marketplace of her home town. Her vending kiosk is located right in the center of the market that is always busy with shoppers. Nataliya has been in this trade for 10 years. Currently, she has 50,000 Grivnyas in inventory. Her gross income is about 18,000 Grivnyas. Profit amounts to 5,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Nataliya is seeking a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to diversify her merchandise. Nataliya’s business has been growing consistently due to her hard work and to having few competitors.  However, she doesn’t plan to stop developing her enterprise. Nataliya is hoping to continue investing her energy and finances in further expansion of her vending venture.

loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Dustmurod

texts.en:
O. Dustmurod is 50 years old, married and has six children. He has secondary school education and has an animal husbandry business. He has a small cow shed where he breeds calves. Because he does not have a specialized education, animal husbandry is the only source of income for his family. 

Dustmurod buys calves on the market at a low price, feeds them and then resells them at the same market at a more profitable price. He provides the market with meat and his family with the necessary food. Dustmurod wants to buy more cows and needs money so he decided to apply for a loan. He will be very grateful to all those who can support him.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. loans.use: Purchasing calves

loans.name: Vincent

texts.fr:
Vincent H., née à Ruhondo ancien prefecture de Ruhengeri, aujourd’hui il se trouve en province du Sud district de Musanze-Rwanda, il est célibataire, il a 24 ans,  son niveau d’éducation est primaire. Il habite en district de Rubavu en province de l’Ouest. Il effectue ce commerce de transport des personnes sur moto à Rubavu, il vient de contracter un prêt au sein d’Amasezerano pour acheter sa moto qu’il utilisera dans son business parlé ci-haut car il louait.
Une partie du profit est  épargné, une autre, il l’utilisera pour payer son  prêt. Dans l’avenir il veut continuer à construire son économie afin de pouvoir se marier et avoir son habitation
texts.en:
Vincent H. was born in Ruhondo, in the former prefecture of Ruhengeri, and currently the Musanze-Rwanda district of the Northern Province. He is a single, 24-year-old man with primary level education. He lives in the neighborhood of Rubavu, in the Western Province. He makes a living transporting passengers on a motorcycle in Rubavu, He was granted a loan with the Amasezerano MFI to purchase a motorcycle, which he had been leasing. Part of the profits will be put aside as savings, whereas another portion will be used to repay the loan. In the future, he wishes to increase his savings in order to marry and get a house.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle for passenger transportation

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer C., 36 years of age, married to Jonah Chepyegon, has been blessed with four children: Chepboswony 13 years, Kiprono 11 years, Kipkurgat 10 years and Jepkoech 10 years. Jennifer runs a kiosk which she started three years ago. From this business she gets an average profit of Kshs 5,000 which she uses to add to her husband's income.

 Jeniffer has taken out a loan of Kshs 10,000, as her first loan from KADET LTD, which she intends to use to buy two bags of sugar for Kshs 5,000, two boxes of bar soap for Kshs 3,000, and Kshs 2,000 for a box of tea leaves.

Jeniffer dreams and hopes that her business will grow and that she will able to meet the needs of her family, especially the education of her children.

loans.use: Will be used to buy stock

loans.name: Bertine Mélanie

texts.fr: Madame Bertine Mélanie C. est une femme mariée de 47 ans qui habite Baye Laye. Elle s’active dans le commerce depuis longtemps et est surtout spécialisée dans la vente de légumes, et détergents (eau de javel, savon liquide).C’était dans le souci d’épauler son mari qui est parti a la retraite qu’elle avait opté pour cette activité de commerce qui est bien rentable pour elle sauf que pendant l’hivernage les légumes se font rares. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis décembre 2003. Elle a déjà remboursé 2 prêts antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 300 000 frs dans le but d’augmenter son stock de marchandises en cette période de Ramadan. Avec l’accroissement de ses bénéfices elle souhaite satisfaire les besoins  de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Bertine Mélanie C. is a 47 year-old married woman who lives in Baye Laye. She has been in business for a long time and specializes mostly in the sale of vegetables and detergents (bleach and liquid soap). She chose this line of business in the hope of helping her husband, who is retired. Her business is profitable except that vegetables are scarce during the winter. She has been a member of the Baye Laye credit union since December, 2003. She has already repaid 2 previous loans. She is requesting a loan of 300,000 francs with the goal of increasing her stock of merchandise in this Ramadan season. She hopes to meet the needs of her family with the increase in her profit.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase working capital

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more building materials

loans.name: God Is Able Group

texts.en:
George W., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called 'God Is Able'.  He is 65 years old, married, and has nine children who are between the ages of 30 and 6 years old. He was only able to attend school through 9th grade due to financial constraints. 

For 4 years, he has been selling soap, oil, milk, onions, tomatoes, sugar, tea, butter, hair grease, etc. in 72nd Market outside of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 8,000 Liberian Dollar portion of this 40,000 Liberian Dollar group loan to buy more soap, oil, milk, onions, tomatoes, sugar, tea, butter, hair grease, etc. 

He describes himself as a dedicated man whose goal is to grow his business.

loans.use: To buy more soap, oil, milk, onions, tomatoes, sugar, tea, butter, hair grease, etc.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.fr: Innocent N., née à Rubavu ancien préfecture de Gisenyi, aujourd’hui il se trouve en province du Sud district de Musanze-Rwanda, il est marié, il a 47 ans,  son niveau d’éducation est primaire.  Il a 9 enfants, le premier a 24 ans et le cadet a 4ans, huit des ses enfants vont a l’école.  Il habite en district de Rubavu en province de l’Ouest. Il est salarié, il vient de contracter un prêt au sein d’Amasezerano pour réhabiliter sa maison  qui n’est pas en bon état. Il a épargné dans le passé ce lui a permis de construire cette maison laquelle il veut réhabiliter, grâce a ces épargnes il a payé le minerval des ses enfants. Dans l’avenir il veut continuer à mieux payer son prêt  afin de pouvoir bien tenir sa famille aisement
texts.en:
Mr Innocent N. was born in Rubavu, in what was previously the district of Gisenyi and which is currently located in the Southern province of the Musanze-Rwanda district. He is married, 47 years old, and completed primary education. He has nine children between the ages of 24 and 4, eight of whom attend school. He lives in the Rubavu district in the West province. He works, and just received a loan from Amasezerano in order to renovate his home, which is not in good condition. He was able to build this home thanks to money he had previously saved, which also allowed him to pay school fees for his children. In the future, he would like to continue paying his loan in order to take care of his family needs.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Renovate his home

loans.name: Masheruka Siimuka Coffee Growers, Bushenyi Group

texts.en:
Hard-working and enterprise-oriented Gordon M., aged 35, is operating a nursery and primary school in Bwizibwera as its director. This started 6 years ago and his school has since been accessed by many pupils due to their academic set standards. This has seen Gordon earn 500,000 Ugandan shillings as monthly profits on top of his salary.

This loan will help him in the construction of more buildings to accommodate pupils and also allow him to purchase furniture for the school like desks for pupils so as to improve their comfort at school. He is very optimistic to make his school grow into the best institution not only in his region but in Uganda. 

Gordon belongs to Masheruka Siimuka coffee growers’ group of members who insure each other in paying back the loan.

loans.use: contribution towards construction of more school buildings

loans.name: Tukolerewamu Association Bakijjulula-Mityana Group

texts.en:
It’s a priceless privilege to be warm-hearted in business terms. This kind of disposition will win spurs for any business person in terms of attracting customers in both the short and long term. 39-year-old K. Recheal who belongs to Tukolerewamu Association Bakijjulura group-Mityana can bear testament to the aforementioned. 

Recheal is a genial mother of 4 who works hard at administering and overseeing her food sales business in Bakijjulura-Mityana. Recheal mostly sells potato chips, doughnuts and soft drinks. She has used those good fundamental elements in her line of conduct to strike a chord with her customers over a period stretching to now 4 years. 

 Recheal is also a teacher and it’s with savings from this that she embarked on her first business which was selling agro produce. She dispensed with it later on after setting forth on this business. In a week, she makes profits that total up to 50,000 shillings and with this loan she wants to buy more potatoes and crates of soft drinks for resale.

loans.use: purchase of more potatoes and  crates of soft drinks

loans.name: Bujaga Farmers, Bushenyi Group

texts.en:
In this world, one needs a pinch of extra effort and hard work to earn a living, especially in this era of stiff competition. To maximize on this point, one M. Topha, aged 46, who studied carpentry, has been running a carpentry workshop for close to 7 years where he makes windows, chairs, tables, doors and many other more products for customers. This business is located in Ishaka, Bushenyi district.

Having had this enterprise alongside his farming practices which earn him an additional income, he is seeking this loan to help him purchase materials including timber, nails, covering cloth and leather covering materials for chairs. This will help him to improve the quality of his products on the market and get him more customers thus more revenue. 

He belongs to Bujaga Farmers group, Bushenyi.

loans.use: Purchasing materials including timber, nails, covering cloth and leather covering materials for chairs

loans.name: Jacques

texts.fr: Jacques N., née à Kamonyi, ancien préfecture de Gitarama, aujourd’hui il se trouve en province de la ville de Kiali-Rwanda, il est marié, il a 46 ans,  son niveau d’éducation est primaire.  Il a 6 enfants, le premier a 17 ans et le cadet a un mois, quatre des ses enfants vont a l’école.  Il habite en district de Nyarugenge, Nyamirambo en province de la ville de Kigali. Il est éleveur des poules,  il vient de contracter un prêt au sein d’Amasezerano pour acheter les petits poussins afin d’augmenter le nombre des ses bétails. Ses épargnes lui ont permis de pouvoir élever les poules pour commercialiser les viandes des poulets et les œufs provenant de son élevage, grâce a ces épargnes il a pu payer le minerval des ses enfants. Dans l’avenir il veut continuer à mieux payer son prêt  afin de pouvoir bien tenir sa famille aisément et de stabiliser son économie.
texts.en:
Mr Jacques N., born in Kamonyi, which was previously in the district of Gitarama, and is currently near the city of Kiali-Rwanda. He is married, 46 years old, and completed primary education. He has six children between the ages of 17 and one month old, four of whom are currently attending school. He lives in the district of Nyarugenge, Nyamirambo, near the city of Kigali. He raises chickens, and recently acquired a loan from Amasezerano in order to purchase baby chicks to increase his stock of chickens. His savings allowed him to raise the chickens and sell both chicken meat and eggs. His savings also allowed me to pay the school fees for his children. In the future, he would like to continue to repay his loan on time in order to take care of his family's needs and to stabilize his economic situation.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase baby chicks to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for milk

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es:
Maria Mercedes de 45 años de edad  trabaja como docente en la Escuela Vigarmy Flores Castro desde hace 25 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos: el mayor de  25 años de edad estudia su tercer año de Educación secundaria y la hija menor de 12 años estudia su sexto grado de Educación primaria. 

Está solicitando  su 9no credito para invertirlo en mejora de su vivienda construyendo la cocina de su casa lo cual le brindarà mayor comodidad a su familia,  esta clienta se ha destacado por ser responsable , honesta, trabajadora, y de cuidar sola a sus hijos, a pesar que son personas humildes son una familia muy unida, viven en un una colonia  donde cada día se va aumentando la población , su sueño es ir mejorando la vivienda y que su hijos sigan preparando para que lleguen hacer alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes is 45 years old. She has been a member of the teaching staff at the Vigarmy Flores Castro school for the past 25 years. She is the single mother of 2 children. Her elder child is now 25 and in his third year of higher education. Her daughter is 12 years old and in 6th grade at primary school. Maria is seeking her 9th loan. She will invest it in improving her home, by building a new kitchen that will better accommodate her family. This client [of the field partner] has shown herself to be a responsible, honest, and hard-working woman who takes good care of her children, and while they are humble people, they are a very close family. They live in an area where they population is growing daily, and it is Maria's dream to go on improving her home and that her children go on learning so that they can make something of themselves in life.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a kitchen

loans.name: Kyatooko Twetungure Group, Rukungiri

texts.en:
K. Yosam of Kyatooko Twetungure group, Rukungiri is a hard working and knowledgeable business oriented man who has been running a grocery shop from Kyatooko, Rukungiri for over 30 years. In here he bakes samosas, cakes, and makes other local item sales of sweet bananas and more with the help from one labourer. 
This business has seen him bask in an average profit of 168,000 Ugandan shillings on top of his monthly pension salary and banana sales from his plantation. Therefore, Yosam is looking forward to restock his business with the support of a loan he is expecting to receive. This will enable him to expand into large scale production.

loans.use: restocking the business

loans.name: Bennah

texts.en:
A very determined and hardworking lady is not afraid of diversity when speaking in economic and lucrative business terms and anything that can earn her profit. T. Bennah, aged 29, is a happily married lady of two children and has been in the agro produce business for over 2 years. She grows food crops like beans, bananas and more in  Rukungiri, which has always earned her 80,000 Ugandan Shillings on a monthly basis.

This loan is to help her purchase manure for her plantation as she looks at diversifying her business.  This is because she did not have enough working capital at the beginning. This will give her a free ticket to earn more revenue and cater for her family's basic needs and also acquire a self sustaining life as she hopes to increase her family income through business expansion.

loans.use: purchase of manure for the banana plantation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more charcoal and pay for business permit.

loans.name: Nabugabo Development Group-Lugazi

texts.en:
B. Sylvia, who belongs to Nabugabo development group in Lugazi, is a 29-year-old business woman who excitedly takes pride in doing her work resolutely and diligently. She says she takes exception to laziness and it is on the strength of that that she has been able to make profitable use of her time overseeing her poultry sales business in Lugazi. 

Sylvia began this business out of her own initiative and ever since then she has been living within the ways and means of this lucrative business. Women owning businesses like these in Uganda are a sign of the times and many are doing well. Things like hard work and determination have become rooted habits for many women and Sylvia is no exception. 

She was previously running a little restaurant but now this is her main business. In a month Sylvia makes profits that add up to 280,000 shillings. She also sells fuel to eke out additional profit. She wants to use the proceeds from this loan to pay for the completion costs on  her house.

loans.use: The completion costs on her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of more clothes materials and sewing machines

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.fr: Fabiola D., née à Gasabo, Kigali-Rwanda, elle est marié, elle a 40 ans,  son niveau d’éducation est tronc commun.  Elle a 3 enfants, le premier a 19 ans et le cadet a 7 ans, deux des ses enfants vont a l’école.  Elle habite en district de Gasabo, en province de la ville de Kigali. Elle est tailleurs des habits,  il vient de contracter un prêt au sein d’Amasezerano pour augmenter l’argent de ses épargnes pour réhabiliter sa maison. Ses épargnes lui ont permis de pouvoir acheter cette maison, grâce à ces épargnes aussi elle fait vivre sa famille. Dans l’avenir elle veut continuer à mieux payer son prêt  afin de pouvoir bien tenir sa famille aisément et de stabiliser sa finance.
texts.en:
Ms Fabiola D., born in Gasabo, Kigali-Rwanda, is a 40 year old married woman who completed primary education. She has three children between the ages of 19 and 7 years old, deux of whom attend school. She lives in the district of Gasabo near the city of Kigali. She is a seamstress, and just received a loan from Amasezerano which she will use to renovate her home. Her savings allowed her to purchase her home as well as provide for the well being of her family. In the future, she would like to continue to repay her loan in order to continue to provide for her family's needs and stabilize her financial situation.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cement, sand and sheet metal to renovate her home

loans.name: Eduardo Reyes

texts.es:
Eduardo de 33 años, tiene una tienda de víveres y  vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil una zona caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y comerciantes informales. 

Inicio su negocio con una percha de madera hace dos años, poco a poco fue incrementando su negocio con víveres para venderlo a sus vecinos. desde ese tiempo el dinero le ha ayudado a mantener a su familia. En la tienda vende arroz, azucare tc. 

El tiene dos hijos de 8 años y otro 8 meses y su esposa que viven en una casa que esta en construcción,  por eso quiere con el préstamo comprar un 50% cemento y pinturas y el otro 50% arroz y azúcar.  En el futuro quiere construir mejor su casa para darle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Eduardo is 33 years old and has a grocery store. He lives in El Fortín (a peri-urban area of Guayaquil), which is characterized by its dirt roads and informal merchants.

He began his business two years ago with a wood perch. Little by little, he expanded his business with groceries to sell to his neighbors. Since then, the money has helped him to support his family. In the store he sells rice, sugar, etc.

He has a wife and two children who are 8 years old and 8 months old. They live in a house that is under construction, which is why he wants to use 50% of the loan to buy cement and paint, and the other 50% for rice and sugar. In the future, he wants to better build his house to provide his family with a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rice, oils, cement, paint

loans.name: Kyanzaire Hiv/aids Tweyambe, Bushenyi Group

texts.en:
K. Zaida, aged 46, is married with a family of four children and has been operating a retail shop from Kashenshero trading centre, Bushenyi for over 6 years. Here she trades in a variety of products, commonly household items like sugar, salt, soft drinks (sodas), water, cooking oil and much more general merchandise. She does this business alongside her other farming practices that include growing a variety of food crops like bananas and poultry keeping. 

Her main drawback is that she has a limited variety of products in her shop that cannot satisfy the customers' demand. Therefore she is looking forward to increasing the stock in her business when she gets a loan and can expand fully. This will help her earn more revenue and sustain her daily needs and further educate her children. 

She belongs to Kyanzaire HIV AIDS group of members who insure each other in paying back the loan.

loans.use: purchase more stock for the business

loans.name: Posiano

texts.en:
This story is connected to one T. Posiano from Kagugu, Rukungiri who has been in the agricultural sector for more than 20 years.  We can say that different genres of agro activities have made many Ugandan families have an improved lease on life.   
                                    
This married man has subsisted on a variety of agricultural products, specializing in growing bananas and looking after cows. Though adverse weather conditions have constantly affected his plantations, he has managed to consolidate the gains he has made. As a result his family of six children has enjoyed the benefits principally; his children have all gone to good institutions of learning. 

In a month, Posiano reveals that he makes good profit from sales of his agricultural products. He is very upbeat that with this loan he will be in a position to improve the mulching and gardening aspects of his farm and also increase the stock of animals on the farm which will help him increase the produce and sales revenue. This will provide a base for him to meet his goal of educating all his children.

loans.use: buying mulches and fertilizers

loans.name: Carmen Maria

texts.es:
Carmen de 25 años de edad es casada, trabaja para el INRUT desde hace 4 años, desempeñandose como contadora. 

Esta solicitando  su 1er credito con el objetivo de construir el año e inodoro de su casa para contar con mayor comodidad en su hogar, ya que como esta esperando su primer bebè desea esperarlo con las mejores condiciones posibles.  

Su mayor sueño es poder brindarle a su bebè las comodidades necesarias para que crezca en un ambiente sano y agradable.
texts.en:
Carmen is 25 years old. She is married and has worked for INRUT for the past 4 years, as an accountant. She is seeking her first loan, with the aim of building a bathroom and toilet in her house, to increase the comfort of her home. She is expecting her first baby and would like to have the best possible living conditions. Her greatest dream is to be able to offer her baby everything it will need to grow in a clean and pleasant environment.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bathroom and toilet

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married to a businessman with a boy and a girl--one in the University, the other one in primary school. She has operated her business of selling handbags and soft drinks (juices) for the last six years. She sells wholesale and retail, door to door and from home. This way, she contributes to her husband's earnings.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to pay school fees for her child. She hopes to be a big supplier of handbags in the future. Her major aim of working with Yehu is to get a loan to raise her standard of living. She owns a house with electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia de 46 años de edad es soltera, sus hijos son mayores y tienen su propia familia unicamente esta bajo su cuidado el menor de nombre Angel que tiene 9 añitos de edad y esta estudiando el 3er grado de primaria. Lucia trabaja para el INRUT desde hace 4 años, desempeñandose como conserje. 

Esta solicitando  su 2do credito con el objetivo de reparar el techo de su casa, pues con las lluvias se le esta metiendo el agua a su casa y desea evitar cualquier enfermedad a su pequeño.  

Su mayor sueño es poder ir mejorando su vivienda para que su hijo crezca con las mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Lucia, age 46, is single. Her children are grown and have their own families. Only one child is under her care, the youngest, whose name is Angel. He is 9 and is in grade 3. Lucia has worked for INRUT for 4 years as a custodian. She is requesting her second loan with the goal of repairing the roof in her home, since the rain has been getting into her house, and she wants to keep her child free of any illnesses. Her greatest dream is to be able to continue improving her home so that her son will grow up in the best conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: roof repairs

loans.name: Richard

texts.fr:
commercant de 40 ans,père d'un enfant de 8ans celibataire s'est lance dans la  fourniture scolaire et divers il ya 17 ans, tres jeune n'ayant aucun soutien,il ouvre un etalage, avec 35000 de capital.Ses ventes sont de 25000 frs par jour.

pour sa strategie il se leve de bonne heure et se rend au marché pour acceuillir les premiers clients ainsi que avoir une diversité des marchandises.

Avec le pret qu'il compte recevoir il va acheter des cartons de cahiers, de livres, ardoise, crayons de couleurs, bic, sac,calculatrice.

Son  ambition est d'avoir une boutique de fournitures scolaires et se marier ainsi de bien scolariser son enfant.
Dans le quartier tout le monde le connait du plus petit au plus grand.
texts.en:
his 40-year old business man is unmarried and the father of an eight-year old child. He launched a business selling school supplies and miscellaneous goods 17 years ago, lacking any resources in his early youth. He started selling from a street stand with 35,000 West African Francs as his starting capital. His daily sales volume is about 25,000 West African Francs now. His strategy is to get up early, arriving at the market in time to greet the first customers, as well as to offer a wide variety of merchandise. With this anticipated loan he will purchase boxes of notepads, books, boards, color pencils, ball point pens, bags, calculators, etc. His goal is to open a school supplies store and be able to get married as well as to provide an education for his child. In his neighborhood, everyone—young and old--knows him well.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing notepads,  bags, books, sets of ballpoint pens and pencils etc

loans.name: St.maria Development A, Mubende Group

texts.en: Joyce N., with raised hand, is a self-motivated member of St Maria development group. She is 28 and the married mother of three children between the age of 11 and 6, who runs a retail shop selling assorted home-use products in Kyenda trading centre, Mubende. She started this business 8 years ago, realizing the market potential in the area. At the end of every month she is able to pocket profits of 140,000 Ugandan shillings. Her main drawback has been having too small a stock to match her customers' demand. She is therefore seeking a loan that will help her stock more goods and  transform her enterprise into a larger one. She is very committed to the business and to good customer care, and hopes to increase her sales revenue. This will bring about a transformation in her business as she hopes to build a family house, achieve a self-sustaining life, and pay for her children’s education.

loans.use: increase  inventory

loans.name: St Maria Development B, Mubende Group

texts.en: N. Federesi, with raised hand, of the St Maria development group is a progressive lady who has operated a veterinary drug shop for more than 10 years in the Kyenda trading centre, Mubende. The widowed mother of 10 children, she had to run this business as well as growing agricultural produce to meet her family needs. This has earned her 400,000 Ugandan shillings per month. She is seeking a loan to buy more drugs for the shop and restock the business in order to meet customer demand. This will tide over her business as she looks at owning a building in the trading centre.

loans.use: buying more stock of drugs for increased inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more bags of slippers

loans.name: Zuena

texts.en:
Zuena is married to a businessman with four children -- three already completed their education and the last born is a university student. She has been operating her business of selling clothes for over ten years, wholesale and retail, door to door and from home.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to pay school fees for her child. She gets some financial help from her other children. Zuena faces the major challenge of transportation and seasonality. She hopes to get a loan to expand her business and become a wholesaler, which is her major aim in working with Yehu. She lives at her own house with no electricity or piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her child.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: Alicia tiene 57 años, su actividad económica es la venta de productos varios. Actualmente ofrece medicamentos de manera ambulante, este negocio lo aprendió de su abuela pues le enseño a ganarse la vida de la forma más honrada, ella tiene 2 hijos que son mayores que le ayudan en lo que puede. Ella solicita este financiamiento para la compra de medicinas pues actualmente tiene muchos pedidos, por lo que es muy importante. Ella sueña con terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Alicia is 57 years old and she works selling various products. She currently sells medicines by traveling. She learned this business from her grandmother who taught her to earn a living in the most respectable way. Alicia has 2 older children that help her with what they can.

She is requesting this loan to purchase medicines because she currently has many requests, which is why it is important. She dreams of finishing building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Nanso Development Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
With sound ideas and tenacity, one’s business operations will never be thrown out of gear. To strike a happy medium in successfully running a business, constant planning is also required.

For 34-year-old S. Steven, of Nanso Development Group, none of the above is out of the ordinary, as he has always been tenacious and has invariably brought forth sound ideas in his ten-year-old fishing and retail shop businesses in Kafunta, Lugazi. With these traits in tow, his businesses have been rejuvenating like giants refreshed in the course of every month.

Steven has been selling mostly smoked fish and a variety of general merchandise items such as sugar, salt, bread, groundnuts (peanuts), paraffin (kerosene) and exercise books. His wife helps him at his retail shop.

Steven started off as a farmer before he became partial to the aforementioned businesses. He also operates a commercial motorcycle business. Hard work, he says, is for him the byword for the success of his businesses.

With this loan, Steven wants to buy more bags of sugar, salt, groundnuts, bread, etc., for resale. He also wants to buy more fishing nets.

loans.use: To purchase more fishing nets and more general retail merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Talemwa Development Group, Lugazi

texts.en:
The hallmark of any successful business person, especially from the point of view of Uganda, has always been having that painstaking hard work modus operandi together with determination and resilience. With these in tow, many people can testify that, even with stiff competition pitted against you, success will always be in your grasp.

40-year-old B. Rehema, who belongs to The Talemwa Development Group in Lugazi, is a testimony to this as she has, in the last decade, manifested all the above in her role as the mover and shaker of her hotel business.

For this mother of four, hard work is like a lullaby. In a month, she makes profits that add up to 200,000 Ugandan shillings. She also ekes out side profits from hiring out fridges. With this loan she wants to revamp her hotel services by constructing a recreational facility and, by and large, improving her overall facilities.

loans.use: To construct a recreational facility and to generally improve her facilities

loans.name: Wazo Tegeta Group

texts.en:
Paulina O. is in her mid-thirties and is married with three children aged 17, 14 and 12. She has been operating a stone quarry as well as a small clothes shop for six years. She works from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m. and makes a good monthly profit.

This will be Paulina’s 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loan to increase her stock of stone for her quarry, a loan which she has successfully repaid. With this loan, Paulina hopes to buy more stone for her quarry in order to expand production. Her dream is to one day start selling her clothes in other cities in Tanzania.

Paulina will share this loan with her loan group, Wazo Tegeta, which totals fifteen members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for the repayment of their loans.

In the photo, Paulina is in the back row, first on the left.

loans.use: To buy more stone for her quarry

loans.name: Sunrise Group

texts.en:
Jeremiah N., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called Sunrise. He is 32 years old, is married, and has two children who are aged 4 and 9 years. He was only able to attend school through 10th grade due to financial constraints.

For seven years, Jeremiah has been selling used clothes in Red Light Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. He plans to use his 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 30,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more bags of used clothes to sell.

Jeremiah describes himself as a friendly man whose goals are to improve his business and continue to educate his children.

loans.use: To buy more bags of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes de este comité  se dedican a variadas actividades entre las que se puede destacar  la venta de ropas, comidas, como empanadas, tortillas, croquetas, asaditos de carne, etc.
La mayoría de las integrantes de este comité son madres de familia y  quienes procuran para mantener sus hogares por lo que día a día se sacrifican mucho para salir adelante. 
 Actualmente este comité se encuentra en su 2do. ciclo en donde se puede destacar el sentido de responsabilidad  en las participaciones en las actividades y en las reuniones y los deseos de progresar que tienen  cada una,  además de la responsabilidad en los pagos. 
 Desean que sus hijos no pasen por las mismas limitaciones laborales y educativas por eso se esfuerzan el doble para poder brindar a sus hijos oportunidades de progreso. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Emilce quien se dedica a la negocio de venta de productos de uso domésticos, aunque no le deja mucha ganancia le ayuda bastante para la alimentación de la familia. 
Así para ella es muy importante este negocio y quiere comprar mercaderías para cargar nuevamente el negocio, mercaderías como fideos, azúcar, arroz, bebidas, y otros.
texts.en:
The members of this committee have a variety of activities among which the following can be highlighted: clothing sales and food (turnovers, tortillas, croquettes, grilled meats, etc.) sales. Most of the members are mothers who sacrifice daily to provide their homes with needed support. The committee is in its second cycle. They have distinguished themselves with their sense of responsibility toward the group activities and meetings and for the wish each has to progress as well as in their responsibility towards repayments. They wish that their children do not go through the same employment and educational limitations they suffered so they try doubly hard to provide their children with opportunities for progress. One of the members is Emilce who sells home use articles. Although it doesn’t produce very high profits it is a help to provide food for her family. This is an important business for her, therefore, and she wants to buy merchandise to restock it. She wants such things as: noodles, sugar, rice, beverages and others.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy noodles, sugar, rice, beverages and others.

loans.name: Stazia Group

texts.en:
Hadija O. is in her mid-forties and is married with five children. She has been operating a small shop selling drinks at Dar es Salaam for around twenty years now. She works from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m. and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Hadija’s 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Her previous loans were used to expand her business as well as paying for her children’s school fees and all were successfully repaid. She hopes for this loan so that she can increase her stock of soft drinks.

Hadija will share her loan with her loan group, Stazia, which totals fifteen members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

In the photo, Hadija is the second from right in the middle, wearing a blue blouse.

loans.use: To increase her stock of soft drinks

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is married with two children of whom one attends school while the other one is six months old and so is too young for school. Her husband is a teacher, contributing his earnings to the family’s other source of income. Jane lives in a rental house with electricity and piped water, citing her greatest monthly expense as food.

Jane has been running a school for the last five years, children from the neighboring community being her potential customers. She pointed out transportation and theft as major challenges in the business. She hopes to build two more streams in her school in the future.

Jane decided to join Yehu so as to obtain a loan to improve her business. With this Kshs 30,000 loan, she wants to build her own house.

loans.use: To build  her own house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more slippers and shoes to sell

loans.name: Nicaise

texts.fr:
Jeune Homme de 47 ans, marie et pere de 2 enfants dont l'age varie entre 12 et 25 ans.En 1985 , il perd son pere et arrete ses etudes ,a cause du manque de soutien, il se lance dans l'apprentissage de la maconnerie.
A la fin de sa formation, il cree sa petite manufacture de fabrique des buses, pavets,latrines, balustres ainsi que d'autres matriels de construction.
A l'octroi de ce pret il pense acheter une tonne de ciment,un camion de 8m3 de sable, un camion de 8m3 de caillasse pour construire 10 buses de 1000m3, 12 buses de 800m3 de 1m.

Il a pour ambition de devenir un grand entrepreneur de renomme hors frontiere , envoyer ses enfants dans des grandes et bonnes ecoles pour compenser ce que lui il n'a pas pu faire, et la fin ameliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Nicaise T. is a young man of 47 years, married and the father of 2 children whose ages range from 12 to 25. In 1985, he lost his father and stopped his studies because of the lack of financial support. He threw himself into masonry training. At the end of his training, he started his little manufacturing business, making concrete pipes, cobblestones, latrines and balusters [railing supports], as well as other building materials. When this loan is granted, he hopes to buy a metric ton of cement, a truck of 8 cubic meters of sand and another of 8 cubic meters of stones to build 10 concrete pipes 1000 cubic meters in size and 12 concrete pipes of 800 cubic meters by 1 meter. Mr. T. dreams of becoming a great businessman, well-known beyond Congo's borders; of sending his children to the best schools to make up for what he himself was not able to do; and finally of improving his family's quality of life.

Translated from French by Jessalyn Pinneo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a metric ton of cement, 8 cubic meters of stones, 8 cubic meters of sand

loans.name: Carmen Alicia

texts.es:
Carmen de 49 años, es profesora de niños en un negocio que ella creo de enseñanzas pre-escolares para niños. vive en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo, caracterizada por la cantidad de habitantes comerciantes. 

Comenzó con su negocio en 1997 cuando se dio cuenta que habían muchos niños por su sector que necesitaban una enseñanza de estudios antes de comenzar la escuela. Comenzó a enseñar ella sola después una de sus hijas le comenzó ayudar, poco a poco incorporo dos personas mas por la cantidad de niños que tenia. Desde ese tiempo hasta ahora ella trabaja desde las 08h00am hasta las 12h00pm todos los días. 

Ahora con el préstamo quiere comprar cemento, pinturas, bloques para readecuar el local donde enseña a los niños. En el futuro quiere tener un local mas grande para los niños.
texts.en:
Carmen, 49, teaches children in a pre-school she opened. She lives in an urban zone called Guasmo which is notable for the large number of informal merchants that live there. She started her business in 1997 when she noticed that there were a lot of children in her area that needed a certain amount of teaching before they started regular school. She started teaching by herself but later on one of her daughters started to help out. Gradually she incorporated two more people due to the number of children she had. Since then and to the present day she works from 8am until noon every day. She will use the loan to buy cement, paint and concrete blocks to refurbish the site where she teaches the children. In the future she’d like to have a larger site for the children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For cement and paint.

loans.name: Pwani Group

texts.en:
Mola R. is in his early forties and is married with six children. He owns and runs a quarrying business, selling his output at his shop which he has operated for eight years. The business is open between 6 a.m. and 12 noon and 4 p.m. to 6 p.m., and makes an acceptable monthly profit.
 
This will be Mola’s 2nd Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania (a Motisha loan is a loan product offered by Tujijenge that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended). He used his previous loan, a loan which he has successfully repaid, to increase his stock of dynamite, which he uses to separate the big rocks. He wishes to use this loan to support his wife’s food shop. His dream is to help the poor.
 
Mola will share this loan with his loan group, Pwani, which totals eleven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for the repayment of their loans.
 
In the photo, Mola can be seen in the middle of the back row.

loans.use: To invest in his wife's food shop

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with four children: three are adults while one attends school. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to the family needs. She lives at her own house with no electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Fatuma has been operating her business of selling dumplings and cooked peas for over ten years, selling in a shop, at the market, door-to-door and from home. In addition, she has rental houses as another source of income. She cites seasonality as her major challenge in the business.

Fatuma decided to join Yehu so as to obtain a loan and improve her standard of living. With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to renovate her house. She hopes to own a well-furnished house in the future.

loans.use: To renovate her house

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Celia, de 57 años, es una mujer sabia y con experiencia, vive con su hija Katy  de 20 años en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Palcamayo. Desde que era niña se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería; “cuidaba a los chanchos de mis padres y ayudaba a la cosecha”, menciona. Con el tiempo ella invirtió su fuerza y su tiempo en progresar, por ello cuando era joven se dedicó a la pastelería, actividad que práctica durante 10 años; y que hasta el momento sigue vendiendo panes, pasteles y demás productos. De las ganancias que obtenía, pudo ahorrar dinero y comprar su propio terreno para cultivar hortalizas, producto que es vendido al por mayor en el mercado central de la capital. Ahora instaló en su casa una pequeña tienda, de esa manera podrá generarse ingresos adicionales. En tanto, no se da abasto para trabajar en la agricultura, por lo que se vio en la necesidad de buscar una socia para que le ayude en la siembra y en la cosecha, de manera que ella solo se ocupa de cuidar sus plantaciones hasta que llegue la temporada de recolección. Su mayor anhelo es comprar y vender terrenos y continuar apoyando a su hija en sus estudios de Agroindustria. Es el décimo crédito con MFP y agradece el apoyo que le proporcionó su banco comunal en el desarrollo de sus objetivos. Con los mil soles que solicita, invertirá en la compra de abono para su próxima cosecha, así como pagar los estudios de su hija.
texts.en:
Celia, age 57, is a wise woman with experience. She lives with her daughter Katy, age 20, in her own home in the Palcamayo area. From her childhood, she has worked in agriculture and with livestock; "I took care of my parents' pigs and helped with the harvest", she says. With time, she invested her strength and time in improving; so when she was young, she worked as a baker for 10 years. She still sells breads, cakes and other products. From her earnings, she has been able to save money and purchase her own land to cultivate vegetables, products which she sells wholesale in the central market of the capital. She recently opened a small store in her home. This way, she will be able to generate additional income for herself. Working in agriculture does not give her enough income, so she found it necessary to find a partner to help her with the sowing and the harvest, so that she only works alone on her land until harvest time. Her greatest wish is to purchase and sell land and to continue supporting her daughter in her agribusiness studies. This is her tenth loan with MFP, and she is grateful for the support that her community bank has offered her in the development of her goals. With the 1000 soles that she is requesting, she will invest in the purchase of fertilizer for her next harvest, and pay her daughter's tuition.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Alvaro Ciro

texts.es:
El joven Alvaro Ciro T. C. tiene 23 años y vive en la Ciudad de Cochabamba en la zona de sur de la ciudad en el barrio conocido como Serena Calicanto a unos 8 km de la ciudad. Actualmente vive con sus padres y sus hermanos mayores.

Alvaro es una persona joven y muy trabajadora que aun no se casa ni tiene hijos, por el momento el enfoca 100% de su tiempo a poder terminar de estudiar y trabajar. Alvaro se dedica al servicio de Transporte de Pasajeros con su taxi por toda Cochabamba y en manera regular en la zona sud con la línea de radio taxis Las Lomas. Esta actividad la realiza hace más o menos 5 años. 

El crédito será utilizado para poder pagar el saldo que debe  por la compra del auto que utiliza como taxi y de esta manera ser oficialmente el dueño de su herramienta de trabajo. Alvaro nos cuenta que su mayor sueño es poder terminar la carrera que está estudiando pronto y de esa manera poder ejercer en esa profesión y poder incrementar así sus ingresos y tener un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Álvaro Ciro T. C., 23, lives in the city of Cochabamba in a neighborhood in the south of the city, called Serena Calicanto, about 8km from city center with his parents and older siblings. Álvaro is a young, hard working man who hasn’t formed a family of his own yet. He is currently focused 100% on finishing his studies and on working. He provides public passenger transportation services with his taxi throughout Cochabamba most regularly in the southern sector associated with the Las Lomas radio taxi service. He has been in this line of work for about 5 years more or less. The funding will be used to pay off his car loan so that he can officially own his work tool. Álvaro tell us that his greatest dream is to finish the career he’s studying soon in order to practice his profession and increase his income and have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay off his car loan.

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
el señor Celso A. tiene 54 años de edad, esta casado con la señora Concepcion Alvarez con quien procrearon 6 hijos y solo dos dependen de ellos.
viven en la Caucara desde hace 20 años dedicandose al cultivo de maiz y a la compra/venta de granos basicos, refrescos, abarroteria en general.
Su pulperia esta ubicado en su casa de habitacion, el credito lo utilizara para compra de refrescos, jugos, arroz, frijoles, azucar, leche, sopas, pastas, harina de maiz y trigo, churros, manteca, aceite, candelas, pan, huevos, pastillas, sal, condimentos, papel higienico.
 
su mayor deseo es que su cosecha sea mejor este año comparada con los años anteriores.
texts.en:
Celso A. is 54 years old and is married to Concepcion Alvarez. They have six children, but only two still depend on them. They’ve lived in Caucara for 20 years, raising corn and buying and selling basic grains, soft drinks, and general groceries. Their general store is located within their home and they will use the money from this loan to buy soft drinks, juices, rice, beans, sugar, milk, soups, pasta, wheat and corn flour, churros, lard, cooking oil, candles, bread, eggs, cakes, salt, condiments, and bathroom tissue. [Celso’s] greatest desire is that this year’s harvest will be better than those of previous years.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Agano Group

texts.en:
Delister S., who is in her late twenties, is married, and has a 7-year-old daughter. Over the past four years she has been operating a small shop from which she sells food and mobile phone credit vouchers. The shop is open between 6 a.m. and 10 p.m. and earns her a good monthly profit.
 
This will be Delister’s first Motisha loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. A Mothisha loan is a product offered by Tujijenge Tanzania that allows borrowers with good credit ratings to pay back their original loans faster and receive extra money before their original loan term has ended. Delister wishes to use this loan to buy spare parts for phones. Her dream is to one day buy a computer for repairing telephones. 
 
Delister will share this loan with her loan group, Agano, which totals eleven members. The members of the group will hold each other responsible for repaying their loans.
 
In the photo, Delister is seen in the first row, first on the right.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for mobile phones

loans.name: Santos Roberto

texts.es:
el señor Santos Roberto L. tiene 40 años de edad, vive en union libre con la señora Nelly Maribel Avila, tienen dos hijos que dependen de ellos.
viven en la colonia la nueva Caucara en donde tienen su casa de habitacion, Santos vende agua en su carro en las colonias y barrios de San Lorenzo, visita las pulperias, retaurantes y escuelas en donde le compran agua en fardo, botellon y juguitos.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas agua en bolsas y botes tambien comprara mas botellones y asi tener un buen inventario de producto ya que todo lo que compra diario se le vende.
con parte del dinero va a hacerle algunas mejoras a su carro en donde transporta la mercaderia.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos Roberto L. is 40 years old and lives with Nelly Maribel Avila. They have two children who depend on them for support. They live in the “La Nueva Caucara” neighborhood, where they have a home. Santos sells water in the areas and neighborhoods of San Lorenzo. He visits general stores, restaurants, and schools where they buy water from him in bulk, in large jugs, and in bottles. He will use the money from this loan to buy more water in bags and cans. He will also buy small bottles so that he will have a good inventory, since everything he buys sells daily. He will use some of the money to make repairs to his vehicle, which he uses to transport the water.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory of water for resale

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Walter Antonio

texts.es:
Walter de 46 años, tiene una tienda de víveres,  vive en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo, caracterizada por la cantidad de habitantes comerciantes. 

Inicio su negocio hace 8 años atrás con unos ahorros que tenia por haber trabajado en una obra de construcción. Ahora trabaja en su tienda de víveres desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días, vende bebidas, granos, lácteos etc.    

El quiere continuar con su negocio por es quiere comprar bebidas, arroz y juguetes para venderlos a los niños. En el futuro quiere tener mas variedad en los productos que vende.
texts.en:
Walter is 46 years old and has a general store. He lives in an urban zone called Guasmo, known for its large number of resident merchants. He started his business eight years ago with the money he earned while working in construction. Now he works in his store from 7:00 AM to 10:00 PM daily. He sells drinks, grains, milk products, etc. In order to continue with his business, he wants to buy drinks, rice, and toys to sell to the children. In the future he wants to be able to offer a greater variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Elizabet

texts.es: Elizabet de 35 años, es una mujer muy honesta y trabajadora, está casada con Ivan de 28 años,  y vive con sus dos hijas, Camila de 4 y Yamila de 2 años, en la casa  de su tío, ubicado en la localidad de Palcamayo. Ella vende todos lo viernes hortalizas en la feria de su localidad, gracias a sus seis terrenos de cultivo, de los cuales dos de ellos están arrendados. Hace 6 años que se dedica a la agricultura, tiempo suficiente para lograr abastecer la demanda que genera las verduras en la capital y esta muy contenta del éxito obtenido, afirma que se dedica al 100 % en su siembra y asegura que todo cultivo  es rentable,”solo tienen que aprovechar al máximo las temporadas de siembra”, menciona.  En estos meses ya cosechará una gran cantidad de espinaca de buena calidad gracias al cuidado y dedicación que les brinda, confiesa además que le gusta cuidarlas y verlas crecer. Próximamente sembrará lechuga y zanahoria; por lo que espera completar sus ahorros y poder comprar más terrenos de cultivo. Es el primer crédito con MFP y esperar aprender mucho de las capacitaciones que ofrecen en su banco comunal. Con los mil soles, comprará semillas, abono y medicina para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Elizabet, age 35, is a very honest and hard-working woman. She is married to Ivan, age 28. She lives with her two children, Camila, age 4, and Yamila, age 2, in the home of her uncle, in the town of Palcamayo. She sells vegetables in the local market every Friday, thanks to her 6 plots of land, two of which are leased. She has been farming for 6 years, which is enough time to generate demand for her vetetables in the capital. She is very happy with the success that she has obtained. She says that she is 100% dedicated to her crops and that all of her crops are profitable; "we just have to make the most of the planting seasons", she says. In the past few months, she has already harvested a large quantity of good-quality spinach thanks to the care and dedication that she provides them. Furthermore, she says that she enjoys caring for them and watching them grow. Next, she will plant lettuce and carrots; so she hopes to finish saving up and to be able to buy more lands to plant. This is her first loan with MFP and she hopes to learn a lot about the training that they offer in her community bank. With the 1000 soles, she will purchase seeds, fertilizer and medicine for her next sowing season.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizer for her next sowing season

loans.name: Jose Saul

texts.es:
el sr. Jose Saul M. tiene 54 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene 4 hijos que dependen de el.
Su trabajo es la compra/venta de agua en bote, botellones, bolsas, refrescos y abarroteria en su casa, ademas realiza trabajos para la alcaldia de San Lorenzo como motorista de una volqueta.
el negocio cuando el no esta lo atiende su compañera de hogar.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de agua.
su mayor deseo es que su familia viva comodamente.
texts.en:
Jose Saul M. is 54 years old and lives with his life partner and four children who depend on him for support. He buys and sells water in cans, large bottles, and bags; buys and sells soft drinks, and groceries out of his home; and also does work for the San Lorenzo city hall driving a dump truck. When he is not at home, his live in partner tends to the business. He will use the money from this loan to buy water. His greatest desire is for his family to live comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Epifania

texts.es: Epifania, de 65 años, es una mujer que lucha contra las dificultades, ella vive con su mamá y su nieta en su casa propia, ubicada en el pueblo de Palcamayo. Hace 40 años se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas como habas y arvejas; los cuales vende en el mercado central de su ciudad. Ahora necesita expandirse más, puesto que tiene mayores responsabilidades, pero como toda mujer, no se acobarda con los retos que le pone la vida; y más ahora que tiene que sobrellevar la muerte de su hija Carolina, tenía 33 años dejando a su nieta en cuidado de Epifania. Su mayor deseo es verla como una profesional; por ello está invirtiendo en la compra de un pequeño terreno para poder cultivar mayor cantidad de hortalizas y llevarlas a la capital de su país, ya que las verduras tienen mayor demanda. Epifania a pesar de su avanzada edad, quiere seguir dedicándose a la agricultura, “es una diversión”, asegura. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP y esta segura que podrá salir adelante con la ayuda de su banco comunal que es muy unido y solidario. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará semillas de maíz y tres costales de abono para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Epifania is 65 years old and she is a woman that fights against difficulties. She lives with her mother and her granddaughter in her own house, located in the town of Palcamayo. For the past 40 years she has worked planting vegetables like beans and peas, which she then sells in her city’s central market.

She now needs to expand, which carries greater responsibilities, but like any woman, she is not afraid of the challenges that life brings her. She now also has to deal with the death of her daughter Carolina, who was 33 years old and left her daughter in Epifania’s care. Her greatest wish is to see her granddaughter as a professional. This is why she is investing in the purchase of a small piece of land to be able to grow more vegetables and bring them to her country’s capital since they have a greater demand for vegetables. Despite her older age, Epifania wants to continue working in agriculture. “It’s fun”, she says.

This is her fourth loan with MFP and she is sure that she will be able to get ahead with the help of her communal bank, which is very united and supportive. With the loan requested, she will purchase corn seeds and three bags of fertilizer for her next planting.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn seeds and three bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 28-year-old married man with two children aged six and four. He is the head of a nuclear family and he lives in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been running a retail shop for two years now and his major constraint is limited capital to invest. Stephen feels that his shop is under-stocked; he intends to use the loan to purchase sugar, soap, and domestic items for selling in his shop.

loans.use: Purchasing sugar, soap, and domestic items to sell in his shop

loans.name: Wilson Peter

texts.es:
Wilson de 52 años, tiene un taller de soldadura y metales, vive en una zona caracterizada por la cantidad de habitantes comerciantes llamada Guasmo. 

Empezó hace 11 años como soldador de puertas y ventanas, poco a poco aprendió de la profesión en un taller, después de un tiempo se independizo y se dedico a aprender y a trabajar como soldador para poder mantener a su familia. Ahora el tiene su taller de soldaduras y metales. Trabaja desde las 06h30am hasta las 17h00pm todos los días.   

Con el préstamo quiere comprar metales y herramientas para su taller. En el futuro quiere tener un taller mas grande y que sus cuatro hijos tengan un buen futuro económico.
texts.en:
Wilson is 52 years old and has a metal and welding shop. He lives in an area, called Guasmo, known for its number of resident merchants. He started 11 years ago as a doors and windows welder. Little by little he learned by working in another shop and eventually went out on his own so that he could support his family. Now he has his own welding shop and works from 6:00 AM to 5:00 PM daily. He will use the money from this loan to buy metal and tools for his shop. In the future he wants to have a larger shop. He also wants his children to have a good financial future.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Tools and supplies

loans.name: Marie Jeanne

texts.fr:
Femme de 47ans mariée et mère de 3enfants dont l'age varie de 12ans à 19ans et ayant 2 personnes à sa charge.Elle se lança dans le commerce de vente des beignets en 1986 .
Après son Bac n'ayant pas pu décrocher du travail dans une société de la place. Elle se lève tot le matin et se rend sur son lieu d'activité à 6h30 afin de debuter la préparation de ses beignets.ses potentiels clients sont les enfants,les vendeurs du marche et d'autre personnes. Ses recettes journalières sont de 35000 frs CFA. 

Avec ce prêt elle veut renforcer son activité en achetant 2 bidons de 25l d'huile,2 sacs de farine,1 sac de 25kg de riz, 1 sac de lait, de la levure, des regimes de bananes.

Malgré les difficulés de rupture des marchandises sur le marché elle à pour strategie de reserver un bon accueil a ses clients,avoir une bonne qualité de  produits,améliorer les conditions d'entretien de son activité.

Elle à pour ambition d'être grossiste, de voyager et d'importer les marchandises. POur ses enfants elle veut la reussite dans leur scolarité et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa familles.
dans son quartier elle est félicité et encourager pour ce qu'elle fait.
texts.en:
A 47-year-old married woman and mother of three children (whose ages range from 12 to 19 years), Mrs. N. also supports two other people. She began selling beignets in 1986 after passing her high school exams, as she couldn't find work in any local businesses. She gets up early and goes to work at 6:30am in order to prepare her beignets. Her potential customers are children, market vendors, and others. Her daily sales amount to 35000 francs CFA. With this loan she would like to build up her business by purchasing two 25-liter containers of oil, two sacks of flour, one 25-kilo bag of rice, 1 sack of milk, yeast, and a number of bunches of bananas. Despite the problems of merchandise scarcity in the market, her business strategy is to welcome her customers warmly, to sell good quality products, and to improve the maintenance conditions of her business. Her goal is to become a wholesaler, to travel, and to import merchandise. She wants her children to do well in school and to improve her family's living conditions. In her neighborhood she is congratulated and encouraged in her endeavors.

Translated from French by Robin Clochard, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of sacks of flour, yeast, two drums of oil, and one 50-kg bag of rice

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
el señor Pablo E. O. tiene 65 años de edad, vive en la aldea el Caimito, tiene 21 años de vivir en ese lugar en donde se a desarrollado junto con su esposa la señora Agueda Nuñes, tuvieron cinco hijos ya todos estan grandes y viven con sus familias.
Pablo se dedica a la venta de hamacas y lazos este producto (lasos) lo compra en el norte del pais y lo vende en las pulperias y clientes que el tiene en diferentes lugares.
el credito lo utilizara para compra de lasos y hamacas ya que tiene varios pedidos y necesita capital de trabajo para la compra de este producto.
su deseo es pasar una vida tranquila en estos años que le quedan.
texts.en:
Pablo E. O. is 65 years old and lives in the Caimito hamlet. He has been here for 21 years, where he and his Agueda Nuñes, have settled. They’ve had five children, all adults now. Pablo sells hammocks and whips. He buys the whips in the northern part of the country and sells them to different general stores and other customers he has. He will use the money from this loan to buy whips and hammocks because he has orders to fill and needs working capital. His desire is to have a quiet life in his remaining years.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Evelien

texts.en:
Eveline is a 29-year-old married man. He has one adopted child who is in school. Evelien has a video library where he rents and sells digital video discs (DVDs), video compact discs (VCDs) and compact discs (CDs). Evelien also has a sound system for rent which is comprised of speakers and amplifiers. He has been in this business for one year.

Evelien is requesting a loan to buy more CDs, VCDs and DVDs. He is hoping to have a great studio in the future in which he will produce films and songs for local artists in order to make more money.

loans.use: To buy more CDs, VCDs and DVDs

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Sam is a thirty-year-old man and very development-minded; he lives in a rented apartment in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is a teacher by profession but feels he should venture into an income-generating activity so as to increase avenues of income to sustain his family. He dreams of owning a residential house for his family. Sam intends to use the loan facility to buy iron sheets and cement for his commercial house construction.

loans.use: Buying iron sheets and cement for his commercial house construction.

loans.name: Kaneez Muhammad Arif's Group

texts.en:
Kaneez M. A. is a resident of Vehari, a small city famous for its agriculture industry located in Punjab, Pakistan. Kaneez is a very talented lady who handles her house and embroiders clothes for her business in perfect order. She always gets up early in the morning, offers up her prayer and then prepares breakfast for her family and gets them ready for work. Then she cleans the house, and after that she starts making embroidered clothes. By doing embroidery work she makes money for her family. She is excellent in her art and receives regular orders.

Kaneez’s husband is involved with livestock. He purchases animals at wholesale, then raises and sells them to his customers to earn a profit.

Kaneez has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan amount he will buy young goats and sheep to raise for resale. Kaneez is hopeful that the decision to investment in her husband’s business will result in good profits and that her family’s financial condition will get better as a result.

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Kaneez.

loans.use: To buy young goats and sheep to raise for resale

loans.name: Roseminda

texts.en:
Roseminda D. is from the town of Banga. She is 51 years old. Roseminda is married. To make a living, Roseminda raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Roseminda also grows ducks and turkeys. She hopes to grow pigs too.

Roseminda joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Roseminda has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Roseminda is requesting a new loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and livestock feed. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and livestock feed

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
la señora Francisca C. tiene 57 años de edad, esta casada y no tiene hijos que dependen de ella, Francisca se ha dedicado al negocio de venta de pescado durante 09 años, sus compras las realiza en coyolito amapala y viaja a comayagua a vender el producto, ahi tiene un hijo que le compra el producto, el pescado lo transporta en termos y viaja en autobus.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas pescados ya que los pedidos ahora son mas grandes y necesita capital para poder comprarlos.
ahora realizara mas viajes en la semana ya que la demanda cada dia es mayor.
 
su deseo es que la crisis politica y economica del pais se mejore.
texts.en:
Francisca C. is 57 years old, is married, and has no dependent children. She’s been selling fish for nine years and buys her supply in Coyolito Amapala and travels to Comayagua to sell her products. She has a son there, who buys from her. She packs the fish into coolers and travels by bus. She will use the money from this loan to buy more fish, because she’s been getting larger orders and she needs working capital. She makes more trips during the week, now that the demand is greater. She hopes that the political and economic crisis in her country will improve.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a forty-year-old peasant man, married with ten children, nine of them below 18 years of age.  He is the head of a family of 15 members based in Fort Portal, Uganda. Edward deals in alcohol distilling and he has been in this business for ten years. From this business he has been able to build a house. 

He boasts of not having any hardships in his business so far and his ambition is to increase his output and supply the region. Edward intends to use the loan to purchase plant seeds for  bananas for increased input of raw material into his alcohol distilling.

loans.use: Purchasing plant seeds for  bananas for increased input into alcohol distilling

loans.name: Sixta Tulia

texts.es:
Sixta Tulia F. vive ene le barrio San Roque donde tiene su negocio de venta de medicamentos Llamado “Farmacia Sixta”. Su negocio se inició hace tres años como una forma de aumentar sus ingresos del hogar porque trabaja con su esposo que conoce perfectamente el área farmaceuta desde hace mas de 20 años, en su negocio se dedican a vender medicina al detal en su local y este se encuentra ubicado justamente en un costado de su casa, ambos, su esposo y ella, prestan sus servicios allí.  
Este es su primer crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, organización a la que vino referida por una vecina y en la que está aplicando a un credikiva con el cual comprará estantes, vitrinas y tambien adicionará mercancías variadas. Su sueño es ampliar su farmacia,  porque sueña con que sus dos hijos de 12 y 14 años lleguen a realizar estudios superiores de buena calidad, mediante el ingreso que le proporcione su negocio en la medida en que este crezca.
texts.en:
Sixta Tulia F. lives in the San Roque neighborhood, where she has a drug store called “Farmacia Sixta.” She started three years ago so that she could increase her household income, because she works with her husband, who knows the pharmacy business very well and has 20 years experience. They sell medicine at retail and their store is located in an area of their home. Both she and her husband provide services there. This will be her first loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, an organization to which she was referred by a neighbor, and through which she has requested a Kiva loan to buy shelves, display cases, and additional merchandise. Her dream is to expand her pharmacy because she wants her children, ages 12 and 14, to complete a good quality higher education, through the income that the business brings through this expansion.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Shelves and display cases

loans.name: Estela

texts.en:
Estela E. is from the town of Banga. She is 51 years old and married. She has six children, the eldest of whom is age 26. To make a living, Estela raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Estela also runs a small sari-sari store where a variety of different products are sold. She is working hard to keep the farm productive and the store growing.

Estela joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Estela has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Estela is requesting a new loan of 12,000 Philippine pesos, which will be used to purchase farm inputs and store supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and store supplies

loans.name: Edwing

texts.es: Edwing, de 29 años, es un hombre trabajador y bueno, tiene dos hermanos pero solo vive con sus padres Aparicio de 60 y Teodora de 55 años, en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Palcamayo. Su vida es significado de esfuerzo, más aún que su razón de progreso y triunfo es su hermana Ana que estudia Gastronomía en la capital; motivo por el cual dejó sus estudios de Teología para apoyarla.  Invierte un promedio de mil soles mensuales en ello, por tal motivo se dedica al cultivo de espinaca, zanahoria y habas, siendo lo cosechado llevado al mercado central de su localidad para su respectiva comercialización. Asimismo viaja dos veces por mes a la capital, para vender su producción a los mayoristas, a precios muy buenos que le permiten obtener buenas ganancias. Le gusta atender, regar y fumigar las plantas porque sabe que las hortalizas tiene mayor demanda que otros cultivos, ahora el quiere incursionar en otros campos como la ganadería, ya que desea intensificarse en la ganadería. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP y esta contento de pertenecer a su banco comunal donde puede compartir sus planes de negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará abono y productos para limpiar la planta de avena y lechuga de bacterias.
texts.en:
Edwing, age 29, is a hardworking and good-natured gentleman. He lives in his own home in the town of Palcamayo with his parents Aparacio (age 60) and Teodora (age 55). Edwing also has two siblings who do not live with them. His life is defined by his efforts. He is motivated to succeed so that he can support his sister Ana who is studying culinary sciences in the capital. Edwing dropped out of seminary so that he could support her.
