He invests approximately 1000 PEN each month into growing spinach, carrots, and beans and brings his produce to the central market in town where he can sell them. In addition, he travels to the capital twice a month to sell his goods to the wholesalers who offer very good prices, which helps him obtain a good income. He enjoys monitoring, watering, and fumigating his crops because vegetables have greater demand than other products. Now he wants to venture into other areas of agriculture, so he plans to intensify his efforts at livestock breeding.

This is his seventh loan with MFP. Edwing is happy to be part of his Communal Bank because the members share their business plans with one another. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy compost and products to rid his oat and lettuce crops of bacteria.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & anti-bacterial products

loans.name: Flosset

texts.en:
Flosset is a 51-year-old widow with six children .She lives in an extended family in Fort Portal, Uganda. She has been in the salon business for 11 months and her biggest challenge is periodic electricity disconnection in the area.  Despite the challenge she wishes to diversify her business and serve male customers hence the need for a loan to buy a standby generator for the salon. 

Flosset intends to use the loan funds to purchase cosmetics and the generator for her salon business.

loans.use: Purchasing cosmetics and  a generator for her salon business

loans.name: Anatilia Josefa

texts.es: Anatila Josefa de 52 años,  tiene una pulpería ella vive en una zona en donde transitan muchos clientes ella caracteriza por brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio, comenzó a trabajar para tener su propio negocio, ya que con sus ahorros pudo comprar muy pocos productos,  pero así con el paso del tiempo es que ha podido avanzar ella tiene 1 hijo a su cargo del que cuida mucho. Con el préstamo quiere comprar golosinas, refrescos, pan, galletas y granos básicos. En el futuro quiere que su hijo tenga una mejor vida y surtir su tienda con más productos.
texts.en:
Anatila Josefa is 52 years old, has a general store, and lives in a zone frequented by many customers. She is known for providing good customer service and has been running this business for more than four years. She began working so that she could start her own business. Her savings only allowed her to buy a few products at first, but after a while she was able to grow. She has one son whom she cares for. [Anatila] will use the money from this loan to buy sweets, soft drinks, bread, cookies, and basic grains. She hopes that in the future her son will have a better life and that she will be able to stock her store with more products.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Naseem's Group

texts.en:
Naseem lives in a small city of Pakistan called Vehari, which is famous for its agriculture industry. She is a working woman who sews clothes to supplement the income of her family. She sews clothes as per customer requirement and also gives a good look to the clothes by using colorful laces and designs. Her clients feel happy to be her customer and give her regular orders.
 
Her husband's name is B. A. and he is involved in the animal-selling business. He first buys animals like goats or cows of a young age and keeps them in the house and takes care of them until they've grown up. Then he sells them to animal markets for a good profit. 

Naseem has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy animals (goats and cows) of a young age and grow them up for reselling. 

She is hopeful that this investment will bring positive change to her husband’s business and he will be able to make his income double in size. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Naseem.

loans.use: To buy animals for reselling

loans.name: Bébé

texts.fr:
Commercante agee de 39 ans,Veuve et mere de 4 ans dont lâge varie entre 3 et 24 ans.Elle s'est lancée dans cette activite depuis l'an 2000,elle gere une chambre froide ou l'on trouve les differents produits dont ses clients ont besoin,ce commerce lui permet de prendre en charge sa famille et toute la scolarite des ses enfants.Ses recettes journalières sont de 200000 à 300000.

Avec le financement qu'elle va recevoir elle compte satisfaire les besoins de ses potentiels clients, s'approvisionner en produits  de  qualite comme la viande fraiche, les differentes varietes de poulets frais et fumes, saucissons,aile de poulet et poissons qui sont tres demandes par ceux ci.

Pour l'élargissement de son activite, elle fait preuve d'une bonne gestion et très rigoureuse dans ses choix.
pour ses perspectives d'avenir , elle pense etre grossiste un jour, importer plus pour faire des grandes benefices .

Tres entreprenante, avec un fort esprit d'initiative elle pense aller loin tout en ameliorant les conditions de vie de sa famille .Elle fait preuve d'un bon temoignage dans son quartier.
texts.en:
This shopkeeper is a 39-year-old widow and mother of four children, ages 3 to 24. She started this business in 2000. She has a cold room where she stores the various products that her customers require. This activity allows her to support her family and pay for her children’s tuition. Her daily revenue varies from 200,000 to 300,000 francs. Her loan will enable her to meet the needs of potential customers. She will stock up on quality products such as fresh meat, a selection of fresh and smoked chicken, sausages, chicken wings and fish, which are in high demand. She will expand her business using good management skills and making rigorous choices. In the future, she hopes to become a wholesaler and import more, thereby increasing her profits. A very enterprising woman with a strong sense of initiative, she expects to go far while improving her family’s living conditions. She enjoys a good reputation around her neighborhood.

Translated from French by Nathalie Pelletier, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cartons of chicken thighs, fish, meat, chicken wings

loans.name: Gladys Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Gladys de 53 años, tiene un negocio de cabinas telefónicas y vive en una zona caracterizada por la cantidad de habitantes comerciantes llamada Guasmo. 

Debido a la falta de oportunidades ella comenzó con un negocio de cabinas telefónicas para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares. Desde ese tiempo ha estado trabajando con las cabinas desde las 08h00am hasta las 21h00pm. Ella ofrece llamadas locales, celulares y algunas internacionales.   

Con el préstamo quiere comprar teléfonos, tarjetas para su negocio de cabinas telefónicas. En el futuro quiere tener un Cyber para tener mas ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Gladys, 53, has a telephone booth business. She lives in an area noted for the large number of informal merchants there called Guasmo. Due to the lack of employment opportunities she started the phone booth business to help meet family expenses. She has been working with the booths since then and is open from 8am until 9pm. She offers local, cellular and some international calls. She will use the loan to buy telephones and call cards for her business. In the future she’d like to have a Internet café in order to have more income for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For sweets, telephones, phone charging cards.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 44 years old. She is married and has five children; the oldest is 18 while the youngest is 2 years old. All of her children go to school except the young one. 

She has a restaurant in which she sells different kinds of snacks, juice, soda, tea and African food such as green bananas, cassava and potatoes. She has been in this business for two years.

She is requesting a loan in order to expand her restaurant business and hire another employee. In the photo, Beatrice is in a white shirt standing with her mother, who has a cloth tied on her head. They work together.

loans.use: Expanding her business

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a sixty-year-old widow living with two grandchildren aged 6 and 14 and she is the head of six members of the family. She operates a confectionery business and has been in the business for the last six years. She owns a house in Fort Portal, Uganda and a bakery which has enabled her to sustain the family. 

She has a challenge of limited supply of raw materials and fluctuating prices of these commodities, thus making it hard to determine her income periodically. Her biggest dream is to have a variety of confectionery to supply in the region thus the need to acquire a loan to re-invest. Her family dream is to have a good  standard of living. The purpose of the loan is to buy wheat, cooking oil, and sugar for making confectionery to sell.

loans.use: Buying wheat, cooking oil, and sugar for making confectionery to sell

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es: Juana Maria tiene 42 años, tiene su actividad que es la venta de productos varios como leña, bananos y otros. Por lo que tiene 1 hijo a su cargo ella es una mujer responsable que siempre está buscando la forma de mejorar sus ingresos, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, pues han sido de gran ayuda para que su negocio avance. Este crédito que realiza es para la compra de materia prima como leña y bananos. Ella con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante, por lo que sueña con ampliar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juana María, 42, sells various products like: firewood, plantains and others. She has a son in her care. She is a responsible woman who is always seeking ways to improve her income. This is not the first time she has negotiated loans because they have been of great use for her business’ progress. This loan will be used to buy firewood and plantains. She has managed to get ahead through much effort and she dreams with enlarging her dwelling.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood and plantains.

loans.name: Karla Estebana

texts.es:
Karla Estebana es una pequeña comerciante,  el cual trabaja mucho para apoyar  a su familia, casada, siendo su esposo conductor.
Su negocio es una pulpería y artesanía que logro poner hace nueve años con ahorros,  el cual ha sido su fuente económica para ayudar a sus hijos.
Hoy en día también vende productos de artesanía, logrando vender ya que como tiene competencia cerca, tiene que esforzarse para lograr tener mejores ventas.
Lleva cuatro ciclos de préstamo en donde ha invertido en productos básicos, logrando aumentar su inventario. Que gracias a los financiamiento ha venido creciendo lo que está contenta por poder invertir.
Comprara: granos básicos, lácteos, carne, golosinas. Así como artesanía que como meta es poder ir a vender al país vecino de Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Karla Estebana is small businesswoman. She works a lot to support her family. She is married and her husband is a driver. Her business is a grocery and crafts store which she was able to open after nine years of saving. It has been an income source to help her children. She sells artisanal products which she is able to sell because she is competent in that area. She makes an effort to obtain higher sales. She has had four loan cycles and has invested in basic products, increasing her inventory. Thanks to the financing, she has grown and she is happy to be able to invest. She will buy: basic grains, dairy, meat, and snacks. She also sells artisanal crafts. Her goal is to be able to sell in the neighboring country of Costa Rica.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy: basic grains, dairy, snacks and artisanal craftts to increase her sales.

loans.name: Sixto

texts.es: Sixto, de 65 años, es un abnegado padre, que cuida de sus 6 hijos pero solo vive con dos de ellos Elva de 21 y Enrique de 22 años, en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Palcamayo. Todas las mañanas se dirige a trabajar como albañil en la construcción de una casa; pero los días que más le gusta a Sixto son los sábados y domingos ya que puede cuidar el cultivo de zanahoria, que hace cuatro meses está sembrando, hace 15 años que se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas y papa, que después los vende en el mercado central de su localidad, pero en tiempos de mayor demanda viaja a Lima para venderlos al por mayor. Dentro de dos meses cosechará zanahoria, asimismo desea invertir en la ganadería, criando vacas y toros; ya que toda una vida la dedicó a la agricultura. Lo que más le gusta, es la tranquilidad que genera estar en el campo y agradece todo lo que pudo obtener de ello. Es el séptimo crédito con MFP y es fiel a su banco comunal ya que estuvo desde que se formó; lucharon y crecieron juntos. Con los mil soles, invertirá una parte en abono y operarios para su siembra de espinacas.
texts.en:
Sixto is 65 years old, a devoted father that looks after his 6 children, though only 2 live with him: Elva, 21 years old, and Enrique, 22 years old. They live in their own home located in Palcamayo. Every morning he starts work; he is a construction working and he is building a house, but Sixto's favorite days of the week are Saturdays and Sundays because that's when he can work in the fields, growing carrots. The carrots were planted four months ago. For the past 15 years he has been growing vegetables and potatoes, produce that he later resells in the central market of his region. But when demand is high he travels to Lima to sell the harvest in wholesale. In two months' time he will harvest the carrots. Later he will invest in livestock, wanting to raise cows and bull after a lifetime of agriculture. What he most enjoys is the tranquility of the fields and he is grateful for all that they have given him. This is his seventh loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he is loyal to his community bank, having been a part since its inception; they worked and grew together. With the one thousand soles he will invest a part in the purchase of fertilizer and part in hiring help to manage his spinach plantations.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and hire help to manage the spinach plantations.

loans.name: Esperanza En Cristo Group

texts.es:
el grupo Esperanza en Cristo tiene como caracteristica que sus integrantes son personas muy honestas y unidas, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

La señora Belkis Marina A. tiene 25 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos, su esposo les ayuda a traves de la remesas que envia de los estados unidos, Belkis trabaja por las noches en un restaurante de la zona y en el dia se dedica a la venta de golosinas como tacos, enchiladas, jugos y almuerzos. 
esta actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años en su casa de habitacion. 
el credito lo utilizara para comprar refrescos, verduras, carnes, tortillas.
 
el señor Oscar Romeo R. tiene 43 años de edad, tiene tres hijos que dependen de el.
su esposa le envia remesas mensualmente de españa. Oscar se dedica a la venta de agua en su carreta desde hace 1 año.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de un caballo que lo utilizara para jalar la carreta en el cual transporta el agua.
 su mayor sueño es comprarse un carro para vender mas agua.
 
la sra. Brenda Esperanza A. R. tiene 22 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos, Brenda se dedica a la compra venta de lacteos desde hace 5 años sus ventas las realiza en barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo, vende su prodcuto desplazandose en su bicicleta.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de queso, mantequilla, ademas vende pan que ella lo hace y lo
cocina en su horno de barro que tiene en casa de su abuela. su mayor sueño es tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
The “Esperanza en Cristo” (Hope in Christ) group is notable because its members are very honest and united. Following are details on the various activities they carry out: Mrs. Belkis Marina A., 25, has two children. Her husband helps them via remittances he sends from the United States. Belkis works nights in an area restaurant and during the day she sells snacks like tacos, enchiladas, juices and lunches. She has been doing this work at home for the last two years. She will use the loan to buy beverages, vegetables, meats and tortillas. Mr. Oscar Romeo Rodríguez, 43, has three children that depend on him. His wife sends him monthly remittances from Spain. Oscar has a cart that he has used to sell water for the last year. He will use the loan to buy a horse to pull the cart in which he transports the water. His greatest dream is to buy a car so that he can sell more water. Mrs. Brenda Esperanza A. Rodríguez, 22, has two children. Brenda is a dairy products merchant. She has been in this line of work for five years selling in neighborhoods of San Lorenzo. She sells her products getting around on a bicycle. She will use the loan to buy cheese and butter. She also sells bread that she herself bakes in a clay oven in her grandmother’s house. Her greatest wish is to own her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy dairy products, vegetables, water and beverages, beef and pork, chicken, tortillas and a horse.

loans.name: Sara Delia

texts.es: Sara Delia de 39 años, la venta de mercadería en general. Trabaja todos los días, pues tiene 3 hijos menores de edad, fue por iniciativa propia que ella inicio este negocio, por lo que anteriormente solo vendía muy pocos productos como lo son cosméticos y ropa, realiza su trabajo de la forma más tranquila ya que le gusta hablar con sus clientes. Con el préstamo comprara lápiz labial, pintura de uñas, ropa, tratamientos y cosméticos. En el futuro quiere incrementar su negocio y que sus hijos puedan vivir bien y que puedan tener una buena educación profesional.
texts.en:
Sara Delia, 39, sells general merchandise. She works every day because she has three minor children. She started the business on her own initiative. She used to sell just a few products like cosmetics and clothes. She works calmly because she enjoys chatting with her customers. She will use the funds to buy lipstick, nail polish, clothes, beauty treatments and cosmetics. In the future she’d like to increase her business so that her children can live well and have a professional education.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Maria Nela

texts.es:
María Nela es una mujer trabajadora, con deseo de superación, se dedica al comercio para apoyar a su familia. Procreo dos hijos, su esposo trabaja en supervisión.
Su negocio es una pulpería que puso hace tres años, con ahorros que su compañero dio. Lo que ha venido a mejorar los ingresos y pagar los gatos básicos de agua y luz.
Atreves del financiamiento ha logrado invertir más en productos lo que ha sido de beneficio para crecer en inventario y lograr mejores ventas.
Con este préstamo quiere hacer un cuarto ya que la casa es pequeña y quiere que sus hijos estén en mejores condiciones. Comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, perlines, zinc para comenzar hacer a construir.
texts.en:
María Nela is a hard-working woman with a desire to improve her situation. She runs a business to support her family. She has had two children and her husband works as a supervisor. Her business is a pulpería [small grocery store] that she started three years ago with savings that her husband gave her. It has improved their income enough to pay the basic expenses of water and electricity. With the loans she has received previously, she has been able to invest more in merchandise, which has been good for growing her inventory and achieving more sales. She wants to build a room with this loan, as their house is small and she wants her children to be in better conditions. To start construction, she will buy construction materials like: stone, sand, cement, ceiling beams, and corrugated metal sheets.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a room, in order to make her children more comfortable

loans.name: Maricela Del Rocio

texts.es:
Maricela de 35 años, tiene una tienda de víveres en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona caracterizada por la cantidad de habitantes comerciantes llamada Guasmo.

Comenzó con su tienda de vivieres para ayudar con los gastos familiares también debido a la demanda de los víveres ella comenzó a comprar enlatados, arroz y aceite poco a poco con esfuerzo pudo surtirla y darle una mejor economía a sus tres hijos. Ahora trabaja con ayuda de sus hijos mayores desde las 06h30am todos los días. 

Para surtir mejor su tienda ella quiere comprar con el préstamo arroz, enlatados etc. En el futuro quiere surtir mejor su tienda y poder así ampliarla.
texts.en:
Maricela, 35, has a grocery store in the front part of her house. She lives in an area called Guasmo that is notable for the large number of informal merchants that reside there. She opened her store to help meet family expenses. In response to demand she started to buy canned goods, rice and cooking oil. Gradually, with much effort, she was able to stock more items and provide a better economy for her three children. Now her two older children help her from 6:30am on every day. To better stock her store she wants to use the loan to buy rice, canned goods, etc. In the future she’d like to stock the store still more in order to enlarge it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For rice, beverages, canned goods.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is a resident of Vehari, a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan, famous for its agriculture industry. A very simple and kind-hearted lady, she spends her time at home carrying out her responsibilities as a housewife. She arises early, offers her prayers and starts work on her household chores. Parveen loves cooking a variety of foods for her family as well as embroidering in her free time.

Her husband, M. A., has a business selling animals, purchasing them from the wholesale market, raising and then selling them to butcher shops and animals markets. His income grows, especially on EID (Muslims occasion). Parveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for his business. With the loan her husband will buy goats and sheep for his business and thereby double his income.

Note: In the picture, the lady who is raising her hand is Parveen.

loans.use: To buy animals for reselling

loans.name: Rajani

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Rajani B., who is married and has three children aged 19, 17 and 13. In 1990 she established her goat-raising business, supporting her family by working seven days a week, five hours a day. Now requesting her first loan from Patan BPW, Rajani wants to purchase food for the goats, and in the future plans to expand the business. Rajani thanks you for your support.

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to its clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: BPW Partner Page Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team"

loans.use: To buy food for goats

loans.name: Zainab's Group

texts.en:
Zainab is a resident of Vehari, a small city located in Punjab Province, Pakistan known for its agriculture industry. A very caring woman, Zainab spends her time at home carrying out her responsibilities as a housewife and mother. Her husband M. has an animal-selling business, purchasing, raising, and then selling them to animal markets and to his individual customers. Zainab also helps him by feeding and watering the animals and keeping their living area clean so they don't contract any disease.

Zainaib has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan her husband will buy goats and sheep with the goal of doubling his income.

loans.use: To buy animals for reselling

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José Luis tiene 24 años por lo que es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante. El se dedica a la venta de productos varios como medicinas naturales. Hace más de 2 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que ha luchado por mantener su actividad que no ha sido muy fácil, el es un hombre muy trabajador que disfruta de este trabajo se encuentra muy contento con financiamiento, pues lo solicito para la compra de productos herbalife. Sueña con comprar su propia casa.
texts.en:
José Luis, 24, is a young man with a strong wish to get ahead in life. He sells various products like natural remedies. He’s had this business for over 2 years. He has struggled to stay in business because it hasn’t been easy. He is a hard working man who enjoys his work and is very happy with the financing because he requested it to buy Herbalife products. He dreams with buying his own house.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Herbalife products.

loans.name: Dalmita Irene

texts.es:
Dalmita de 49 años, vende productos naturales y vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Duran” este lugar esta caracterizado por su ecología en disolución.  

Ella comenzó cosiendo ropa cuando llego a vivir en ese sector pero como necesitaba mas ingresos ya que es madre soltera decidió comprar  productos naturales a base de noni, calcio y frutos y los comenzó a vender a sus amigos y conocidos. Ahora ella tiene un pequeño local de nutrición y venta de productos naturales.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar mas productos a base de noni, calcio y frutas. En el futuro quiere ser distribuidora al por mayor de productos naturales.
texts.en:
Dalmita, 49, sells natural products. She lives in a periurban area called “Duran” that is noted for its deteriorating ecology. She started sewing clothes when she first moved to this sector but, being a single mother and needing higher income, she decided to buy natural products based on Noni, calcium and fruits and started to sell them to friends and acquaintances. She now has a small nutrition bar and sells natural products. She will use the loan to buy more Noni, calcium and fruits based products. In the future she wants to be a wholesale distributor of natural products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For Noni and fruit based natural products.

loans.name: La Cuesta Group

texts.es:
el grupo La Cuesta esta ubicado en la aldea que lleva su mismo nombre, esta formado por cuatro pèrsonas dos hombres y dos mujeres todos vecinos que se dedican a diferentes actividades que les generan ingresos para salir adelante. a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellos realizan:

el señor Jacinto F. tiene 49 años de edad, esta casado y  tiene 5 hijos, algunos le ayudan con el ganado que el tiene y cultivo de maiz, el señor Jacinto tiene ingresos que son de la venta de cuajada, leche, molino de
moler maiz, Jacinto vive comodamente y es una persona muy trabajadora y honesta. el credito lo utilizara para invertirlos en la compra de toretes para la venta ya que el tiene una pequeña pesa en donde destaza reses y las comercializa en mercados de la region.
 
la sra. Santos Dominga V. Reyes tiene 38 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene tres hijos que 
dependen de ella, Santos tiene casa propia y un vehiculo que le sirve para transportar el producto
que ella vende que son verduras, todos los dias sale a vender la verdura que compra en Tegucigalpa y la vende en San Lorenzo y caserios, va tres veces por semana y se tarda dos dias en vender lo que trae de verduras.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de verduras.
 
don Juan Maria F. C. tiene 44 años de edad, esta casado y tiene cinco hijos que dependen de el, Juan  
se dedica a la cria y venta de ganado y tambien a la venta de leche y cuajada desde hace hace varios años.
don juan es una persona muy solidaria y seria dedicada a su familia y a su negocio.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de un torete.
su mayor sueño es tener mucho ganado y asegurar el bienestar de su familia.

la sra. Jessica Yolibeth C. M. tiene 29 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene dos hijos que
dependen de ella, su marido es policia preventivo sus ingresos familiares provienen de la compra venta de verduras que compra en Tegucigalpa y la vende en Nacaome y San Lorenzo,  va dos veces por semana y vende su producto en su vehiculo,  tiene a una persona que maneja el carro y ella atiende al cliente que va a comprar, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años. el credito lo utilizara para invertirlo en la compra de mas verduras para asi obtener mas ganancias y suplir las nececidades de su familia.
texts.en:
The group “La Cuesta” is located in the village that has the same name. It is comprised of 4 individuals – two men and two women who are neighbors and have different business from which they earn income and use to get ahead. Below are more details on their different businesses:

Jacinto F. is 49 years old, married, and has 5 children. Some of his children help him with his cattle and with his corn crops. Jacinto receives income from selling curd, milk, and corn mills. He lives comfortably and is a very hardworking and honest person. He will use the loan to invest in the purchase of young bulls to sell since he has a small weight where he cuts beef and sells them in the markets of the region.

Santos Dominga V. Reyes is 38 years old, lives in a common-law marriage, and has three children who are her dependents. Santos has her own house and a vehicle that she uses to transport the vegetables that she sells. Every day, she goes out to sell the vegetables that she first purchases in Tegucigalpa and then sells in San Lorenzo and neighborhoods. She goes to Tegucigalpa three times each week and it takes two days to sell the vegetables that she brings. She will use the loan to purchase vegetables.

Juan Maria F. C. is 44 years old, married, and has five children who are his dependents. He works raising and selling cattle as well as selling milk and curd. He has been doing so for several years. Juan is a very supportive and reliable person, dedicated to his family and his business. He will use the loan to purchase a young bull. His biggest dream is to have a lot of cattle and be assured of the well being of his family.

Jessica Yolibeth C. M. is 29 years old, lives in a common-law marriage, and has two children who are her dependents. Her husband is a policeman. Her family income comes from the purchase and sale of vegetables that she first buys in Tegucigalpa and then sells in Nacaome and San Lorenzo. She goes to Tegucigalpa twice a week and sells her products from her vehicle. She has a person that drives the car and she attends to the customers. She has been in this business for the past 2 years. She will use the loan to invest in the purchase of more vegetables so that she can have more earnings and meet her family’s needs.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, cattle, milk, beans, corn, rice, sugar, butter, oil, margarine, corn and wheat flour, salt, and soaps.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Naseeman's Group

texts.en:
Naseeman M. Y. is a housewife who lives in a small city in Pakistan called Vehari that is famous for its agriculture industry. Naseeman’s husband sells goats. He has been involved in this business from a young age. He couldn’t get an education because he had to assist his father in his livestock trade. So he has plenty of experience in this type of business. He specifically deals with goats because his clientele base is butchers. He sells goats to butcher shops and earns a good profit.

Naseeman has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan her husband will buy a good quantity of goats for his business. Naseeman is very confident that her husband has the ability to make his business profitable, and he will surely do so by using the loan money in this way.

loans.use: To buy goats for resale

loans.name: Ananta Kumari

texts.en:
This is 44 year-old Ananta Kumari K.C. She is married and has five children aged 23, 19, 17, 16 and 14. In 1985 she established her vegetable farming business. Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she supports her family. With this first loan from Patan BPW, Ananta Kumari wants to purchase seed. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

With a Kiva loan, Patan Business and Professional Women borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With these a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence level and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

About Patan BPW:

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner microfinance institution, Patan Business and Professional Women (BPW). Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates. Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To buy seed

loans.name: Maria Pricila

texts.es:
la señora Maria Pricila O. tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella. Maria no tiene casa propia y renta desde hace 8 años, su fuente principal de ingresos la constituyen la comercializacion de frutas y verduras, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años, Maria esta ubicada en la calle del comercio en donde antes existia el mercado viejo de San Lorenzo frente a casita Show.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas frutas y verduras para asi de esa manera vender un poco mas y de esa manera mejorar sus ganancias y asi salir adelante con sus dos hijos, la hija mujer esta cursando la secundaria y su mayor deseo es que se gradue de la universidad.
texts.en:
Maria Pricila O. is 43 years old, a single mother, and has two children who are her dependents. Maria does not have her own house and she has been renting for the past 8 years. Her main source of income is her fruit and vegetable sales, which she has done for the past 5 years. Maria is located on the street Calle del Comercio where the old San Lorenzo market used to be, in front of Casita Show.

She will use the loan to buy more fruits and vegetables so that she can sell a little more and that way, increase her earnings and get ahead with her children. Her daughter is currently in high school and her greatest wish is for her to graduate from college.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bananas, nances, apples, grapes, pineapples, mangoes, and avocados.

loans.name: Swastika

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Swastika T.. She is married and has two children aged seven and three. In 1985 she established her tea shop. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she supports her family. She wants to use loans from Patan BPW to increase inventory in her store. In the future, Swastika plans to expand the business. She thanks you for your support.

Whether on the streets of Kathmandu or in the villages outside of the capital, tea shops are places of business and meeting in Nepal. Called a chiya pasal, these tea shops make a sweet, milky tea that can be purchased for a few cents a cup. With a Kiva loan, Patan BPW's borrowers are able to keep their store shelves stocked while increasing their profit margins by buying in greater volume.

About Patan BPW:

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner microfinance institution, Patan Business and Professional Women (BPW). Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates. Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To increase inventory in her shop

loans.name: Zainab Muhammad Murad's Group

texts.en:
Zainab M. M. lives in a small city called Vehari that is located in Punjab, Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. Zainab is a housewife who stays at home and does her household work. Her husband is M. M., a milkman by profession. He has a buffalo from which he gets milk and sells it to different milk shops so as to generate income for the family. Zainab also helps her husband by taking care of his buffalo and milking it as well. M.’s buffalo gives him almost 8-10 kg. of milk per day, and he sells 1 kg. of milk for 45 PKRs. In this way he earns approximately 450 PKRs every day.

Zainab has applied for a loan from Kiva’s partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan her husband will buy another buffalo for his dairy. Zainab is hopeful that with the additional buffalo her husband’s income will double in size and increase his customer base as well.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo

loans.name: Kledyn Yolibeth

texts.es:
la señora Kledyn Yolibeh R. F. tiene 24 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos hijos.
su actividad es la venta de tamales, chorizos, chanfaina y frito de cerdo esta actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años. 
Kledyn todos los dias se levanta de mañana para preparar las comidas y sale a vender hasta en la tarde
al mercado viejo de San Lorenzo.
gracias a su negocio puede pagar su renta y la manutencion de sus dos hijos.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de harina de maiz, hojas de platano, leña, carnes de cerdo y pollo, chicharrones y otros materiales para hacer los tamales.
su mayor sueño es tener su propia casa en donde sus hijos puedan crecer sanos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kledyn Yolibeh R. F., 24, is a single mother of two children. She sells tamales, sausages, chanfaina (a stew-like dish made with offal) and frito de cerdo (fried pork with rice or yucca). She has been in this line of work for five years. Kledyn rises early in the morning every day to prepare the meals and then goes out to sell them in the afternoon in San Lorenzo’s old market. Thanks to her business she is able to support her two children. She will use the loan to buy corn flour, banana leaves, firewood, pork and chicken, fried pork skin and other supplies for her tamales. Her greatest wish is to have her own home where her children can grow up healthy.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood, sausages, corn flour, vegetables, pork, chicken, banana leaves, condiments, salt.

loans.name: Mithu

texts.en:
This is 60-year-old Mithu T.. She is married and has four children aged 37, 27, 26 and 20. In 1985 she established her livestock business. Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she supports her family. She wants this loan from Patan BPW to buy feed for her cattle. In the future Mithu plans to expand the business. She thanks you for your support.

About Patan BPW:

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner microfinance institution, Patan Business and Professional Women (BPW). Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates. Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To buy feed for her cattle

loans.name: Mira

texts.en:
This is 22-year-old Mira K.C. She is married and has no children. In 2005 she established her livestock business. Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she supports her husband and herself. She wants to use this loan from Patan BPW to buy feed for her cattle. In the future Mira plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

About Patan BPW:

This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner microfinance institution, Patan Business and Professional Women (BPW). Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community.

For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates. Join our lending team: BPW Lending Team.

loans.use: To buy feed for her cattle

loans.name: Rita Araceli

texts.es:
Rita de 40 años, vende almuerzos en su casa vive en una zona periurbana llamada la Perimetral esta rodeada del estero salada y muchas casas de caña a su alrededor. 

Ella comenzó la venta de comida porque su familia siempre a vendido comida. Readecuo un local y lo convirtió en un comedor para vender comida. Inicio con pocas sillas y una mesa pero gracias a la demanda de clientes y sus ahorros pudo estabilizar su negocio. Sus hijas le ayudan a preparar la comida mientras que ella atiende el local. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar, legumbres para hacer mas platos y variar un poco en el menú. En el futuro quiere tener  ya un negocio establecido y que su esposo tenga su propio taller de soldadura.
texts.en:
Rita, 40, sells lunches at home. She lives in a periurban area, called Perimetral, that is surrounded by a salty estuary and lots of houses made from sugar cane stalks. She started selling meals because her family has always sold food. She refurbished a spot and turned it into an eatery to sell food. She stared out with just a few chairs and a table but thanks to customer demand and her savings she was able to stabilize her business. Her daughters help her prepare the food while she tends to customers. She will use the loan to buy rice, sugar and vegetables to make more dishes and vary the menu a bit. In the future she’d like to have an established business and that her husband has his own welding workshop.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For rice, sugar, vegetables.

loans.name: Genesis Group

texts.es:
el grupo Genesis esta ubicado en el Barrio San Antonio de la ciudad de San Lorenzo, esta integrado por 5 mujeres luchadoras y con muchos deseos de superacion, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

la señora Lourdes Yanina O. A. es casada y tiene una hija que depende de ella, junto con su esposo se ayudan economicamente para salir adelante. Lourdes se dedica a la venta de golosinas como ser tacos, enchiladas, tortillas con quesillo y jugos naturales de piña y naranja. el credito lo utilizara para comprar los materiales para fabricar las golosinas.

la sra. Marta Marina V. B. se dedica a elaboracion y venta de tortillas desde hace 2 años, su negocio lo tiene en su casa de habitacion, tiene dos personas que le ayudan a la elaboracion de las tortillas.
Marta entrega las tortillas a un restaurante de la zona. el credito lo utilizara para la compra de
leña, y maiz.

la sra. Ada Martiza G. C. tiene 33 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos. junto con su esposo se ayudan economicamente.
Ada se dedica a la compra y venta de cosmeticos marca AVON este negocio consiste en compras de perfumes, desodorantes, talcos, cremas, shampo, y muchos articulos mas, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 9 años.
su producto lo vende con los empleados de las empacadoras de camaron.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de cosmeticos.

la sra. Carmen P. tiene 63 años de edad, es soltera y tiene dos nietos de los que ella se ha hecho cargo ya que
sus padres no estan en el pais, Carmen se dedica desde hace 3 años a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas,
sus clientes son sus vecinos y personas a los que les da crédito de quince dias.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz y leña.

la sra. Jessica Jisela G. tiene 29 años de edad,  tiene un hijo, Jessica se dedica al comercializacion de peluches, plasticos, cameras, ropa de segunda, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años, sus clientes son de los lugares aledaños a San Lorenzo, vende el producto de puerta en puerta ya que dice que se vende mas que tener un puesto en algun lugar.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar plasticos, peluches, ropa de cama y ropa usada.
texts.en:
The Genesis group is located in San Lorenzo’s San Antonio neighborhood. It is composed of five tenacious women with strong drives for self improvement. Following are details of their various activities: Mrs. Lourdes Yanina O. A. is married and has a dependent daughter. Together with her husband they help each other get ahead economically. Lourdes sells snacks like: tacos, enchiladas, tortillas with cheese and natural pineapple and orange juice. She will use the loan to buy ingredients to make these snacks. Mrs. Marta Marina V. B. has made and sold tortillas for the last two years. Her tortilla shop is located in her home. She has two helpers that help her make tortillas. Marta sells the tortillas to a local restaurant. She will use the loan to buy firewood and corn. Mrs. Ada Martiza García C., 33, is the mother of two children. She and her husband work together to help each other economically. Ada is an AVON saleswoman. She buys perfumes, deodorants, talcs, creams, shampoos and many other items. She has been in this line of work for 9 years. She sells her items to employees of a shrimp packing firm. She will use the funds to buy cosmetics. Mrs. Carmen P., 63, is single but has two grandchildren in her care because their parents are abroad. Carmen has made tortillas for sale for the last 3 years. Her customers are neighbors and people to whom she extends credit for fifteen days. She will use the funds to buy firewood and corn. Mrs. Jessica Jisela G., 29, has a son. She sells stuffed toys, plastic items, cameras, used clothing. She has been in this line of work for 2 years. Her customers are from areas neighboring San Lorenzo. She sells her products door-to-door and says she sells more this way than if she had a fixed stand someplace. She will use the loan to buy plastic items, stuffed toys, bed linens and used clothing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, vegetables, chicken, cooking oil, clothes, plastic items, tortillas, lard, pork, beef and chicken, cheese, pineapples, oranges, firewood, cosmetics, stuffed toys, cameras and used clothes.

loans.name: Sandra Del Socorro

texts.es: Sandra del Socorro tiene 43 años ella se dedica a la venta de discos. Desde pequeña ella siempre ha buscado la forma de mejorar sus ingresos, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos que han sido importantes para seguir adelante con su negocio, es así que ella se motiva todos los días para ofrecer a sus clientes la variedad de sus productos. Ella sueña con seguir adelante con su negocio y establecer otro local para generar más ingresos.
texts.en:
Sandra del Socorro is 43 years old. She sells CDs / DVDs. Since she was very young, she has always sought ways of increasing her income, and this is therefore not the first time that raising finance has been important to the development of her business. She is motivated every day by the desire to offer her customers variety in the products she sells. Her dream is to keep growing her business and to become established in another location so that she can generate additional income.

Translated from Spanish by Rosa Oswald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marina

texts.en:
Marina sells women’s clothing outfits from rented space in the local mall. Marina is married with two children. Her family is an average Ukrainian family living in the town of Novaya Kahovka. She launched her business 17 years ago in the volatile perestroika times to be able to provide for her family’s basic needs. Currently, Marina has 70,000 Grivnas in inventory. Monthly net profit amounts to 7,000 Grivnas. 

Marina is requesting a loan of 20,000 Grivnyas to increase the assortment of merchandise in her mall outlet. She believes that the loan will help her meet her customers’ demands and increase selection of merchandise for the fall season. Marina realizes that at all stages in her business development, it is important for her to offer a wide variety of items in order to keep a good reputation and attract more customers. This loan will enable her to continue building a solid foundation for her business so that it will be successful for many years to come.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Creciendo Juntas Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su primer ciclo se han iniciado como comité hace muy poco tiempo y luego de las sucesivas reuniones decidieron concretar el grupo y recibir los créditos y capacitaciones de la Fundación Paraguaya.
Se puede decir que el grupo es muy responsable, todas las integrantes tienen actividades todas están muy deseosas de recibir los crédito y poder invertir en la mejoras sus actividades. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Liliana A. se dedica a la venta de ropas y también elabora productos de limpieza que le da a sus hijos mayores a vender. 
Con estas actividades ella está muy satisfecha y espera mejorar ya que le vendrá muy bien si consigue aumentar las ventas de su negocio. 
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de ropas para la temporada que entra en el país y así ofrecerle mercaderías novedosas a sus clientes como remeras, blusas, vestidos, zapatillas y otros.
texts.en:
The current committee is in its first loan cycle. It began only a short time ago and after consecutive meetings they decided to solidify the group and receive loans and training from Fundación Paraguaya. The group is very responsible. All of the members have jobs and they all really want to receive loans and to be able to invest in the improvement of their businesses. One of the members is Liliana A.. She sells clothing and also makes cleaning products which she gives to her older children to sell. She is very satisfied with these activities and she hopes to improve, since it would be very useful to continue increasing her business' sales. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of clothing for the season that the country is entering, and to offer innovative clothing to her customers such as t-shirts, blouses, dresses, shoes and other items.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of t-shirts, blouses, dresses, shoes and other items.

loans.name: Jocelinda

texts.es: Jocelinda, de 25 años, es una mujer ambiciosa y luchadora, vive con sus padres y su hermana Lisbet de 22 años, en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Palcamayo. Cuenta que desde los 15 años prepara panes para venderlos en su localidad y ahora ya tiene su propia panadería, donde vende tortas y pasteles; pero con ello creció sus responsabilidad, ya que su hermana Lisbet deseaba estudiar enfermería en la universidad, es ahí que Jocelinda decidió incursionar a la agricultura ayudando a sus padres en la siembra de arveja, papa y hortalizas. Es así que el fin de semana va a supervisar los cultivos y negocia los precios en el mercado central, tanto de su ciudad como el de la capital. Lo que más le gusta a Jocelinda es ayudar a su familia, ahora quiere comprar mayor mercadería para su panadería, además desea adquirir su propio terreno, de esa manera poder cultivar mayor cantidad de hortalizas y abastecer la demanda que genera. Es el primer crédito con MFP y está segura que su banco comunal la ayudará a salir adelante. Con los mil soles, completará el crédito que ahorró, para cultivar 4 bolsas de semilla de arveja, abono e insumos para la nueva cosecha de este mes.
texts.en:
Jocelinda is 25 years old. She is an ambitious and hard working person. She lives with her parents and with her sister Lisbet who is 22 years old. They live in their own home located in Palcamayo. Since she was 15 years old she has been baking breads for sale in her neighborhood and today she has her own bakery from where she sells pies and cakes. Her responsibilities soon grew when her sister, Lisbet, wanted to study to be a nurse at the university. So Jocelinda decided to study agriculture to help her parents in the harvests of sweet peas, potatoes, and vegetables. On the weekends she goes to supervise the fields and she barters for the best prices in the central markets in her city and in the capital. Jocelinda's favorite thing to do is to help her family. She would like to purchase in wholesale a stock of merchandise for her bakery with the goal of one day having her own fields. She will be able to have larger harvests of vegetables and be able to meet the demand. With the one thousand soles she requests she will supplement her savings to be able sow 4 bags of pea seeds, purchase fertilizer and other materials for the new harvest this month.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase four bags of pea seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Katty Cecilia

texts.es:
Katty tiene un puesto de carnes y vive en una zona periurbana llamada la Perimetral esta rodeada del estero salada.  Inicio vendiendo carnes para seguir con el mismo negocio que la mama tenia. Poco a poco con esfuerzo ella a podido comprar un congelador y distintas carnes para la venta. 

El trabajo lo realiza todos los días con la ayuda de su mama ya que ella tiene experiencia en vender carnes. Para seguir con su negocio ella quiere comprar mas carnes con el préstamo y así tener mas clientela.  

En el futuro quiere tener un local de carnes mas grande y surtida con varias carnes conocidas por todos los comerciantes.
texts.en:
Katty has a meat store and she lives in a periurban zone called La Perimetral, which is surrounded by salt marsh. She started selling meat to continue in the same business that her mother had. Bit by bit, with effort, she was able to buy a fridge and different meats to sell. She works during the day with her mother's help, since she has experience selling meat. In order to continue with her business she wants to buy more meat with this loan and thus have more customers. In the future she wants to have a larger meat store, stocked with various meat and known by all the merchants.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: meat

loans.name: Virgen De Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Virgen D. Guadalupe inicia su segundo ciclo, las socias son del Distrito D. Huaytara.
La señora Berta es casada y tiene 4 hijos ya mayores y un nieto que esta a su responsabilidad y le gustaría que sea profesional, Berta venD. golosinas, negocio que inicio con un capital D. 200 soles y luego fue incrementando con los prestamos D. su Banco Comunal, su nieta y esposo le ayudan en su negocio. Además Berta siembra alfalfa que venD. a los ganaderos.
Berta solicita un préstamo que será invertido en la compra D. galletas, caramelos y chocolates.
Los sueños D. Berta son mejorar su negocio y que su nieta culmine sus estudios y sea profesional.
texts.en:
The Virgen D. Guadalupe Community Bank is starting its second cycle. The partners come from the Huaytara district. Berta is married and has four adult children and a granddaughter who is under her care. She would like for him to become a professional. Berta sells snacks. She started the business with a capital of 200 soles and kept growing it with the loans from her Community Bank. Her granddaughter and her husband help her with her business. Berta also growns alfafa and sells it to cattlemen. She is requesting a loan to be used in the purchase of cookies, candies and chocolates. Berta's dream is to improve her business and for her granddaughter to finish her studies and to become a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cookies, candies and chocolates.

loans.name: Sol Naciente Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Sol Naciente son del Distrito de Huaytara.
La señora Eugenia es conviviente, tiene 38 años y 3 hijos que estudian, Eugenia vende gaseosas, helados y quesos, en su casa, el negocio de queso lo inicio cuando compro su refrigeradora y le esta yendo bien, y durante el tiempo que esta en Finca aprendió a ahorrar y como administrar bien su negocio. Su préstamo será invertido en la compra de quesos.
Los sueños de Eugenia son que sus hijos continúen sus estudios y tener una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
The members of the Rising Sun Communal Bank (Banco Comunal Sol Naciente) live in the Huaytara District. Sra. Eugenia is 38 years old, has a live-in partner, and has 3 children in school. Eugenia sells sodas, ice cream, and cheese in her house. She started her cheese business when she bought her refrigerator and she is doing well. During the time she was with Kiva Field Partner FINCA, she learned how to save money and manage her business well. Your loan will be invested in the purchase of cheese. Eugenia's dreams are that her children will continue their studies and that she will have a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Angela Yeh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cheese

loans.name: Dios Es Amor Group

texts.es:
Las socias del Banco Comunal Dios es Amor son del Distrito D. Pilpichaca, las principales actividades son la crianza D. alpacas.
Maximina es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo, Maximina venD. comidas en la feria D. San Felipe y su comunidad, además venD. golosinas, Maximina solicita un préstamo que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar.
Maximina tiene un terreno en San Felipe y desea construir una casa para implementar un restaurante y así mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
The members of the communal bank Dios es Amor (God is love) are from the Pilpichaca district. Their main work is raising alpacas. Maximina is a single woman with one son. She sells food at the San Felipe market and her group also sells candies. Maximina is asking for a loan to buy rice and sugar. Maximina has a lot in San Felipe and she wishes to build a house to set up a restaurant and thus improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar and rice

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira, de 50 años de edad, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Su labor cotidiana de todos los días de  Elvira, es la venta de gas y el cambio de sencillos para que realicen llamada en su teléfono. Todas las veces que utilizan el teléfono público, que esta situado en la ventana de su casa, los usuarios buscan sencillos en monedas, y para ello Elvira siempre esta al pendiente y a la vez que aprovecha en vender gas. En estos negocios lleva más de 6 años, trabajando con mucha seriedad y responsabilidad, ganándose  así la preferencia de sus vecinos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la comunicación con sus clientes, además que le genera buenas ganancias económicas que le permiten ayudar en los gastos del hogar. En adelante tiene planeado terminar de construir su casa para alquilar cuartos. Es el onceavo crédito con MFP, y como líder de su grupo se compromete en ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará balones de gas y también tarjetas virtuales para llamadas telefónicas.
texts.en:
Elvira, 50 years old, is a very hard working and responsible mother. She lives in her own home with her husband and their 3 children. Elvira's daily job, is selling gas and coin exchange to make calls on their telephone. All the times that they use the public telephones, which are located in the window of their home, the users are looking for a coin exchange, and Elvira is always waiting there for them and at the same time takes the opportunity to sell gas. She has run these businesses for more than 6 years, working seriously and responsibly, earning the favor of her neighbors. What she likes the most about her job is the communication with her customers, as well as the fact that is earns her a good financial profit that allows her to help in the household expenses. In the future she has plans to finish building their house in order to rent out rooms. It is the eleventh loan with MFP, and as leader of her group she promises to be punctual with the payment of her installments. With the loan that she is asking for, she will buy gas cylinders and also virtual access cards for telephone calls.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock up on gas cylinders.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: For natural products.

loans.name: Gaudencio

texts.es: Gaudencio, de 68 años, es un hombre muy entregado a su trabajo, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos más su nieta. Con mucho esfuerzo, Gaudencio logró comprar su carro, después de haber trabajado durante largos años como chofer de bus. Ahora trabaja con su propio carro haciendo servicio de taxi, de las 7.00 de la mañana a 9:00pm de la noche, es así que viene trabajando durante estos 24 años. El trabajo que realiza le apasiona mucho, ya que, ni el descanso médico que le dieron; por la operación de su vista, ha mellado sus ansias de seguir trabajando. El prefiere trabajar; antes de aburrirse en su casa, y además con las ganancias que obtiene cubre  las medicinas de su esposa que sufre de diabetes. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es la conversación que entabla con cada uno de sus pasajeros. En lo sucesivo tratará de mantener en óptimas condiciones su carro, para que pueda seguir trabajando eficientemente. Es el onceavo crédito con MFP y se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará llantas para su carro para renovar las que tiene.
texts.en:
Gaudencio is 68 years old and he is very dedicated to his work. He lives in his own home together with his wife, their two children and his granddaughter. With a great deal of work, Gaudencio managed to purchase a car. He worked many long years as a bus driver to achieve this goal. But he works with his own car now and he provides taxi services from 7 in the morning until 9 at night. He has had this schedule for the past 24 years. He is very passionate about his work. Even the medical leave he had to take following an eye operation did not deter his wish to keep working. He prefers to work instead of being bored at home. The earnings that he gains also cover the medicines his wife needs. She suffers from diabetes. What he most likes about his work is the conversations he has with each one of his passengers. He will endeavor to keep his car in good working order so that he may keep working efficiently. This is his eleventh loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he is committed to be on time with his payments. With the loan he requests he will purchase replacement tires for his car.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase replacement tires for his car.

loans.name: San Miguel De Ayacucho Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal San Miguel D. Ayacucho inicia su ciclo 7 con 17 socias.
FioreL. es miembro D. L. junta directiva del Banco Comunal, es conviviente y tiene un hijo D. 3 años, FioreL. junto a su mama se dedican a L. compra y venta D. animales, viajan a las ferias para realizar su negocio. Además siembra verduras en tierras D. su familia, sus productos los comercializa en el mercado D. abastos. FioreL. trabaja en una tienda como vendedora.
FioreL. solicita un crédito que será invertido en L. compra D. animales.
Los sueños D. FioreL. son tener una casa propia , brindar una buena educación a su hijo y negocio propio.
texts.en:
The San Miguel D. Ayacucho communal bank is starting its 7th cycle with 17 members. FioreL. is a member of the governing board. She has a live-in partner and a 3 year old son. FioreL. and her mother buy and sell animals. They travel to the various livestock fairs to do conduct business. She also farms vegetables on her family’s farmland and she sells her agricultural product to the wholesale foodstuffs market. FioreL. also works as a salesperson in a store. She is asking for funds to buy animals. Her dreams are to own her own house, to proviD. a good education to her son and to have her own business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy animals.

loans.name: Francisca Alexandra

texts.es:
Francisca de 40 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Duran” este lugar esta caracterizado por su ecología en disolución.  

Ella empezó como vendedora ambulante de frutas afuera de una escuela como tubo suficiente clientela ella pudo comprar artículos para vender poco a poco fue incrementando sus ganancias y decidió que la mejor forma de pasar tiempo con su familia y obtener dinero era teniendo su propia tienda. Por esa buena decisión ella tiene ahora su pequeña tienda de dulces y víveres.

Para darle una mejor vida a sus hijos ella quiere comprar con el préstamo materiales de contracción para readecuar su casa. En el futuro quiere terminar de surtir su negocio y construir mejo su casa.
texts.en:
Francisca is 40 years old and has a small store in the front of her house. She lives in a semi-urban area called "Duran," which is characterized by its diminishing ecosystem. She started off selling fruits on foot outside a school. As she had enough customers, she was able to buy more items to sell and little by little, she increased her income. She decided that the best way to be able to spend time with her family and earn money would be to have her own store. Because of that good decision, she now has her small store where she sells sweets and food items. In order to provide her children with a better life, she wants to use this loan to buy construction materials to renovate her house. In the future, she would like to finish stocking her business and to improve the construction of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy cement, cinder blocks, and paint

loans.name: 5 De Mayo Group

texts.es:
El comité “5 de Mayo” tiene más de  2 años de formación y trabaja con la Fundación Paraguaya, la mayoría de sus integrantes ya  realiza actividades productivas, pero incluyen entre sus integrantes a 4 señoras que emprenderán actividades.
 Incluyen entre las actividades realizadas la venta de frutas y verduras , venta de comestibles artesanales como empanadas de carne ,empanadas de pollo ,empanadas de jamón y queso ,venta de mercaderías varias.
Anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles los materiales para su desarrollo y formación. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Maria quien se dedica  a la venta de ropas en su domicilio, y de esa manera ella obtiene sus ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Es una actividad que ella lo viene realizando hace bastante tiempo y lo hace con la ayuda de sus hijos.
Ella desea renovar las mercaderías que tiene para la temporada de primavera que entra en el país.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de remeras, shorts, camisas, vestidos y otras prendas.
texts.en:
The “Cinco de Mayo" group has been together and working with Fundación Paraguaya for more than two years. The majority of its members are engaged in productive activities already, but the group also includes four women who will learn businesses. The types of work performed by the members include selling fruits and vegetables; selling traditional foods like meat empanadas, chicken empanadas, ham and cheese empanadas; and selling various merchandise. They yearn for their children to have a better future, and this is why they strive twice as hard to provide them with the things they need for their development and growth. One of the members is Ms. Maria, who sells clothing from her home to earn income to help her family. She has been doing this work for quite a long time, and her children help her with it. She would like to change up her merchandise for spring, which is just starting in their country. She is requesting this loan to purchase knit tops, shorts, blouses, dresses, and other garments.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy knit tops, blouses, shorts, polo shirts, dresses, and blouses

loans.name: Virgen De Bronce (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El Banco comunal Virgen de Bronce está formado por 11 socias, son mujeres con mucho sentido del humor que luchan día a día  para ofrecerles  a sus familias un mejor porvenir. Viven por el sector de la Virgen del Bronce en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es conocida por su belleza natural, su centro histórico, su gente y su gastronomía.

La Señorita Sonia B. vive por el sector de la Virgen del Bronce, este es el tercer crédito que realiza y tiene una muy buena amistad con todas las socias de la banca comunal. Nuestra socia tiene 31 años de edad es soltera y tiene una niña de un año y nueve meses, vive en casa de sus padres los que tienen casa propia.
La Señorita. Sonia es estilista pero por el momento no ejerce su profeción, se dedica hace 3 años a la cría de cerdos, ella compra cerdos, los cría un tiempo y luego los vende.  Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de un cerdo y el alimento para todos sus animales.
 
Su meta es  llegar a tener su gabinete de belleza para ejercer su carrera.

La Señora Narcisa T. vive por el sector de la Virgen del Bronce, tiene de 44 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 22, 18, 13 años de edad. Su primera hija es modista y trabaja, su segunda hija estudia en la universidad y su última hija  en el colegio, su esposo es de profesión artesano, gracias al trabajo conyugal están construyendo su casa propia.
Doña Narcisa es artesana y se dedica a la elaboración de bases para flores y cuenta con una floristería, arreglan los salones para todo tipo de evento social como  matrimonios, cumpleaños etc., labora en su negocio de domingo a domingo sin tener un horario fijo. Este es el sexto crédito que realiza en la banca comunal, los cuales le han servido mucho en su negocio. El nuevo crédito lo va invertir en la compra de materia prima para realizar sus arreglos florales.
 
Su meta es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
The communal bank Virgen de Bronce is made up of 11 members. They are all women with a good sense of humor that strive day after day to give their families a better future. They live in the Virgen del Bronce neighborhood in the city of Cuenca. This city is known for its natural beauty, its historic downtown, its people and its cuisine. Señorita Sonia B. lives in the Virgen del Bronce neighborhood. She is 31 years old, single and has a 21 month old daughter. She lives with her parents who have their own house. This is her third loan and she has a good rapport with all the members of the communal bank. Señorita Sonia is a stylist, but at the moment she is not pursuing her profession. She has been raising pigs for the last 3 years. She buys pigs, raises them for a time and then sells them. With this loan she will buy a pig and feed for all her animals. Her goal is to have a beauty parlor so she can pursue career. Señora Narcisa T. lives in the Virgen del Bronce neighborhood. She is 44 years old, married and has 3 children ages 22, 18 and 13. Her oldest daughter works as a seamstress, her second daughter is a university student and her youngest daughter is in high school. Her husband works as a craftsman and because of their joint work efforts they are building their own house. Doña Narcisa is also an artisan and makes bases for flowers and has a flower shop. She arranges rooms for all types of social events such as weddings, birthdays, etc. She works everyday and doesn't have a fixed schedule. This is her sixth loan with the communal bank. The loans have been a big help to her business. With this loan she will buy materials to make flower arrangements. Her goal is to finish her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a hog and feed for all the animals.  Also, to purchase flowers, pots, etc.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia, de 32 años, vive en su casa que es propia a lado de su esposo German, de 32 años que es profesor, y de su pequeña hija Ana de 4 años. Ella siempre ha sido de las personas que aceptan los retos y por tal motivo continuo trabajando a pesar de las constantes dificultades que se le presentaban. El esfuerzo que dio tuvo su recompensa, ahora su librería está bien implementada, además que tiene la ventaja de estar ubicada al frente de un colegio, asimismo ofrece el servicio de fotocopiadora. Por otro lado brinda maquinas de videojuegos, y le va muy bien pues obtiene considerables ganancias que le permiten ayudar a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Luego del éxito de este negocio, logró juntar algo de dinero, por lo que ha instalado otra librería donde atiende un empleado. Lo que le gusta es que ha logrado buenas ganancias, pero no puede salir mucho por no descuidar ambos negocios, y como es una mujer emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado mejorar las instalaciones de su negocio para ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere decepcionar a todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Lidia tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cuadernos y papelería en general para surtir mejor ambos negocios, y ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lidia is 32 years old and she lives in her own home together with her husband, German, 32 years old and a teacher, and with their 4-year old daughter Ana. She has always been a type of person to set goals for herself so she has always continued to work despite the constant obstacles that got in her way. But the efforts she expended came with their reward. She has a well equipped book store with photocopy services. But she also has video game machines and it has been successful. With her considerable income she is able to contribute with her husband to the household expenses. With the success of her business she soon managed to save some money to she has managed to set up another book store, this one managed by an employee. She is very happy to see such good earnings but she cannot go out for long periods of time, to not neglect either business. She is a business woman and her plans for the future are to improve the infrastructure of her stores to provide a greater level of service to her clients. This is a first time loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is committed to making the payments on time. She does not want to let down all the people who have made these funds possible, funds that allow her to progress in her business. Lidia's plans are to invest the loan requested in the purchase of notebooks and other general office supplies to stock both businesses and to offer a wider variety of products to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase notebooks and office supplies.

loans.name: Siomara Del Socorro

texts.es: Siomara Del Socorro tiene 34 años, su actividad es la venta de cosméticos. Hace más de 3 años que se dedica a este negocio ella tiene todas las esperanzas de salir adelante, ya que ella no tenía la oportunidad de mejorar sus ingresos pues no había terminados sus estudios universitario, ya que sus padres no le habían dado la oportunidad de finalizar fue por eso que inicio este negocio con muy poco capital. Actualmente esta solicita este crédito para la compra de lápiz labial, brillo, tratamientos, pintura de uñas, colonias y cremas. Ella sueña con establecer una pulpería en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Siomara Del Socorro is 34 years old and sells cosmetics. She has dedicated herself to this business for more than three years and she has every hope of getting ahead in life. She did not have the opportunity to improve her earnings by finishing university, because her parents didn't give her the opportunity to do so. That is why she started this business with very little money. Currently, she is requesting this loan to buy lipstick, gloss, treatments, nail polish, colognes, and creams. She dreams of someday opening a small grocery store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy lipstick, gloss, treatments, nail polish, colgnes, and creams

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio de 47 años, vende ropa junto a su esposa en un pequeño local viven en una zona periurbana llamada “Duran” este lugar esta caracterizado por su ecología en disolución.  

Comenzó a vender ropa invirtiendo sus ahorros por los problema económico y para que su esposa pudiera tener otro ingreso, con sus pocos ahorros compro ropa y comenzó a vender en su pequeño loca, por la buena clientela continuo con su negocio hasta ahora trabaja desde las 08h30am hasta las 20h00pm. 

Para mejorar sus ventas el quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa. En el futuro quiere que su negocio crezca y que sus dos hijos terminen los estudios con éxito.
texts.en:
Julio, 47, sells clothes with his wife in a small locale. They live in a periurban zone called Duran, notable for its deteriorating environmental conditions. He started selling clothes investing his own savings due to economic problems and so that his wife would have an extra source of income. With his meager savings he bought clothes and started to sell them in his small store. Thanks to his good customer base he continued with the business and now he is open from 8:30am until 8pm. To improve sales he wants to use the loan to buy clothes. In the future he’d like his business to grow and that his two children successfully finish their studies.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For clothes.

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: Mario, de 45 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposa Irene de 42 años y de su pequeño hijo Marti de 10 años, juntos y con muchas ganas de salir adelante habitan en un barrio comercial ubicado al norte de la ciudad. Desde joven aprendió a manejar autos y luego cuando debió sacar adelante a su familia no dudo en empezar a trabajar brindando el servicio de taxi por las calles de la gran ciudad. Ya han pasado varios años y dice que en la actualidad obtiene regulares ganancias, pues no solo trabaja con ocasionales pasajeros, sino también con pasajeros fijos, que lo llaman cuando quieren movilizarse con seguridad. Además como su auto es propio él mismo fija sus rutas y horarios, pues le agrada trabajar solo de día y por las noches descansa.
