Por lo general empieza a trabajar desde las 6 de la mañana, hasta las 6 de la tarde, y solo descansa a la hora de almuerzo. Así transcurren  los días de este empeñoso hombre, que tiene pensado  para el futuro comprar un auto más, y brindarlo en alquiler. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas, pues no quiere decepcionar a las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le pemitira continuar con su negocio. Mario tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de llantas nuevas para su auto, pues las que tiene están algo deterioradas; además mandará su auto a la mecánica, pues necesita mantenimiento, de esta manera espera mejorar el servicio que ofrece.
texts.en:
Mario is 45 years old and he lives in his own home together with his wife Irene, 42 years old, and their young son Marti, 10 years old. They live in a commercial district located north of the city. Since he was young he learned to drive a car and later when he had a family to support, he never thought twice about providing taxi services in the streets of this great city. Many years have passed and he now has a steady source of income, especially because he does not only work with occasional passengers but he also has some steady clients that call him when they need to travel safely and securely. Additionally, since it is his own care that he drives he decides his own routes and his own schedule. He likes to work alone in the days and at nights he rests. Generally he starts work at 6 in the morning and finishes at 6 in the evening, only taking a break for lunch. This is a typical day for the hard working person. In the future he has planned to purchase another car and rent it out. This is a first time loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he is committed to making his payments on time. He does not want to disappoint the people that made this loan possible, a loan that will let him continue his work. Mario will invest the loan requested in the purchase of new tires for his car. The ones on his car now are very old. He will also bring his car to the repair shop for maintenance. This way he expects to improve the service he is able to offer.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To provide his car with necessary maintenance.

loans.name: Hormiguitas Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal “HORMIGUITAS” está iniciando su segundo ciclo. Está conformada por 8 personas, siete mujeres y un varón. La mesa directiva esta constituida por la señora Lucy como presidenta, la señora Cinthia como tesorera y la señora Ruth como secretaria.

Para una mejor organización, la asociación conforma subgrupos para el proceso de pago, son llamados grupos solidarios y están dirigidos por la jefe de grupo. La señora Victoria es jefe de un grupo, constituye el primer control dentro del grupo y la persona que agiliza el proceso de repago en la reunión. Ella ya tiene experiencia de trabajo en Pro Mujer.  El negocio que desarrolla es la costura de ropa para bebé.  Antes trabajaba con micro talleres de América Textil, desde hace tres años trabaja independientemente.

Su crédito ha sido solicitado para comprar insumos: como por ejemplo hilo, tela.  Produce las pequeñas prendas en su domicilio y luego entrega su producción a sus clientes para la venta por menor.  De parte de la familia tiene el apoyo de una de sus hijas.
Con respecto a Pro Mujer, ella considera que el Consultorio de Salud es una ayuda y por eso es lo que más le gusta.

Las otras integrantes de la asociación también tienen sus propios negocios: venta de jugos y costura, venta de salchipapa, costura de ropa de bebe, peluches, conducción de transporte, artesanía de camas y venta de cosméticos.
texts.en:
The “HORMIGUITAS” (Little Ants) communal bank is starting its second cycle. It has 8 members, seven women and one man. The governing board consists of Lucy, President, Cinthia, Treasurer and Ruth, Secretary. To improve organization the bank formed subgroups to process payment. They are called Solidarity Groups and are led by a Group Leader. Victoria is leader of a group. She is the first level of control within the group and the person who expedites the repayment process during the meeting. She has prior work experience in Pro Mujer. The business she’s in is manufacturing infant wear. She used to work in América Textil micro workshops but has worked independently for the last three years. She has requested funds to buy supplies like fabric and thread. She makes the tiny items of clothing in her home and delivers the finished products to her customers for subsequent retail sales. One of her daughters helps her. With respect to Pro Mujer she considers the Health Center to be a great help and that is what she likes best about it. The other group members have their own businesses: games sales, seamstress services, sale of salchipapas (fried potatoes with fried sausages), infant ware manufacturing, stuffed toy making, public transportation services and artisanal beds and cosmetics sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Alex

texts.es: Alex H. N., tiene la edad de 25 años, está en unión libre, y vive con su compañera. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de artículos para su negocio. Desea tener un inventario más amplio y variado de los artículos de su bazar. Tiene varios años de haber empezado con este negocio, y cuenta con muy buenos clientes, por eso ve la necesidad de ofrecer mayor variedad de productos en el negocio, además de aportar mayores ingresos para la economía de su hogar. Es la primera vez que realiza un crédito con FUDECOSUR y está muy agradecido con las facilidades que se le brindaron. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo como persona y como comerciante.
texts.en:
Alex H. N., 25, is in a common law relationship; he lives with his partner. He will use the loan to buy merchandise for his store. He wants to have a more varied inventory in stock. He started the business several years ago and that’s why he now sees the need to offer a greater variety of products as well as to bring increased income to the home. This is his first loan request with FUDECOSUR and he is very grateful for the loan terms offered to him. He hopes to provide his family with better quality of life and improved economic stability in the future and to continue growing both as a person and as a merchant.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Juana De La Cruz

texts.es: Juana de la Cruz es una Señora muy tranquila y se caracteriza por brindar un  buen servicio a sus clientes. Además que ella elabora y vende rosquillas, por lo que siempre su vivienda es muy solicitada por sus vecinos, amigos y familiares que llegan a comprar. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza este financiamientos para su negocio, hace mas de 10 años que se dedica a este humilde medio de vida pues su Mama estaba interesada que Juana aprendiera a esta actividad para que saliera adelante y mantuviera a su familia. Este crédito es  destinado para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus roquillas.
texts.en:
Juana de la Cruz is a tranquil woman who is noted for providing good service to her customers. She makes and sells Rosquillas (a typical Nicaraguan cookie) so her home is always crowded with neighbors, friends and family who come by to buy. This isn’t her first loan for the business. She has been in this humble way of earning a living for over 10 years because her mother was interested in Juana’s learning this activity so that she could get ahead and support her family. The loan will be used to buy ingredients to make Rosquillas.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to make rosquillas (cookies).

loans.name: Hilda María

texts.es:
La Señora Hilda U. es socia del banco comunal Señoras de Taguan, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre, que  pertenece al cantón Sigsig, su gente se dedica a la elaboración de sombreros de paja toquilla, a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.
 
Nuestra socia tiene 40 años, es viuda hace 7 años  y tiene  6 hijos de 21, 18, 15, 13, 10 y 6 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive en su casa compartiendo los gastos, su segunda hija trabaja y es quien le ayuda económicamente, su tercer  y cuarto hijos estudian en el colegio de la localidad y su último hijo en la escuela. Con su trabajo ha lograda construir su casa propia.
 
Doña Hilda  trabaja en el bar de un colegio hace 5 años, labora desde las 7 a.m. hasta las 2 p.m. de lunes a viernes, también se dedica a la cría de cerdos.
 
Este es el tercer crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de productos para el bar como son gaseosas, aguas, confitería etc.
 
Su meta es tener más chanchos para la cría.
texts.en:
Mrs. Hilda U. is a member of the Señoras de Taguan (Ladies of Taguan) communal bank. She lives in Taguan, Sigsig canton. Its residents make panama hats, raise farm animals and farm. She is 40 years old, widowed for seven years and has six children who are 21, 18, 15, 13, 10 and 6 years of age. Her oldest daughter is married and lives in her house sharing expenses. Her second daughter works and helps her economically. Her third and fourth sons are in the local secondary school and the youngest is in elementary school. Her work has made it possible for her to build her own house. Hilda has worked in the high school’s snack shop for five years. She works from 7am until 2pm from Monday through Friday. She also raises pigs. This is the third loan she’s gotten in the communal bank and she will use it to buy merchandise for the snack bar like soft drinks, water, sweets, etc. Her goal is to have more pigs to raise.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy candy, soft drinks, water, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es:
Marcelina con 62 años de edad, se dedicada a la siembra y venta de alfalfa, papas y habas, lo distribuye al por mayor y menor a diferentes mercados,  lleva casi 40 años dedicada a este negocio.
Marcelina empezó esta actividad a raíz de que su esposo fue despedido del trabajo en una empresa minera, es así como ellos salieron de la Ciudad, y fueron a vivir a una  zona rural donde compraron sus chacras para el sembrío de diversos tubérculos y frutos, como también flores; hoy en día, son propietarios de un terreno que lo adquirieron en Lima, lograron construir su casa de material rustico (adobe), compraron sus cosas para su uso domestico.
 El préstamo que se le ha otorgado lo invertirá para comprar semillas de papa, ya que requieren mayor capital.
 Marcelina testifica que con la ayuda de EDAPROSPO ha podido mejorar en su negocio,  los créditos recibidos han sido un apoyo para el progreso de su familia.
texts.en:
Marcelina, 62, is an alfalfa, potato and lima bean farmer. She sells her product at wholesale and retail in various markets. She has been in this business for almost 40 years. Marcelina started this activity because her husband was fired from his job at a mining company. That led to their leaving the city and moving to a rural area where they bought farmland to grow various tubers and fruits as well as flowers. Today, they own a lot in Lima, they built their adobe home and bought items for home use. The loan she got will be used to buy potato seed because they need more capital. Marcelina states that EDAPROSPO’s help has made it possible for her to improve her business. The loans she has gotten have been a support to her family’s progress.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy potato seeds.

loans.name: La Misiones Group

texts.es:
Banco de emprendimiento que se encuentra en su 2do ciclo integrado por 10 integrantes los cuales todos viven en la zona de San José 
Actividad  es variado como ser  venta de joyas, frutas, abarrote, comida, servicio, cosméticos, etc.   La  Presidenta: la Sra. Rosmery de 31 años y vive en la comunidad San José.Su Negocio es la venta de  joyas  y cosméticos   hace 8 año en la misma zona don de vive, Estado civil: concubina con el Señor Rider su actividad es la de albañil hace 10 años  y cuenta con 2 hijos  que se encuentran en edad escolar, con el dinero del crédito desea comprar cosméticos y joyas de catalogo que se encuentran en promoción.  
                                                                                                  La Secretaria es la Sra. Ana María vive en la zona de San José y cuenta con el negocio de venta de abarrote en san José en su mismo domicilio, su Estado civil: concubina  con el señor David que trabaja en la comunidad San Pablo en una empresa, su cargo es operador de oruga, los señores tienen un  hijo a su poder, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de azúcar, arroz, aceite, refrescos, etc. Al por mayor.
                                                                                 
La Tesorera es la Sra. Cristina  cuenta con el negocio de venta de fruta en la zona de la ramada estado civil: concubina con el señor Benedicto, albañil trabaja en la zona de san José  los señores cuentan con 4 hijos que se  encuentran en edad escolar, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de fruta al por mayor.                                                                                                        Los clientes se sienten muy agradecidos con la entidad financiera por depositarles la confianza a sus personas.
texts.en:
This enterprising bank, which is in its second loan cycle, consists of 10 members. All of them live in the San José zone. They have various business activities, such as the sale of jewelry, fruit, groceries, food, services, cosmetics, etc. The president is Sra. Rosmery, who is 31 years old and lives in the community of San José. Her business is the sale of jewelry and cosmetics. She has been in business for 8 years in the same zone where she lives. She lives with her partner, Señor Rider, who has been a bricklayer for 10 years. They have 2 children, who are of school age. With the money from the loan, she wants to buy cosmetics and jewelry which are on sale in a catalog. The secretary is Sra. Ana María, who lives in the San José zone and has a grocery business in her home. She lives with Señor David, who works in a business in the community of San Pablo, where he operates heavy machinery. They have one son in their care. She will use the money from the loan to buy sugar, rice, oil, sodas, etc., wholesale. The treasurer is Sra, Cristina. Her business is the sale of fruit in the La Ramada zone. Her partner is Señor Benedicto , a bricklayer who works in the San José zone. They have four children of school age. She will use the money from the loan to purchase fruit wholesale. These bank members are very grateful to this financial institution for the confidence shown in them.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise and increase working capital

loans.name: Leonardo Enrique

texts.es:
Leonardo de 34 años, tiene una pequeña panadería en una parte de su casa, vive en una zona periurbana llamada “Duran” este lugar esta caracterizado por su ecología en disolución.  

Por la falta de oportunidades desde pequeño el comenzó a trabajar en una panadería y a ganar su propio dinero, cuando creció decidió que esa iba a ser su principal actividad económica. Compro un horno pequeño y comenzó hacer panes y venderlos por el sector. Ahora el hace panes y rosquitas rojas de harina (en la foto se las ve) para sus clientes desde las 08h00 hasta el anochecer. 

Para seguir con su negocio y que la producción de pan sea mas rápida el quiere comprar con el préstamo maquinas. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa ya que ahora es de caña.
texts.en:
Leonardo, age 34, has a small bakery in part of his house. He lives in a periurban zone called "Duran". This area is characterized by its distressed ecology. Due to lack of opportunities, he started working in a bakery at a young age to make his own income. When he grew up, he decided that this would be his main job. He bought a small oven and started to make bread and sell it throughout the area. He now makes breads and red donuts from flour (pictured in the photo) for his customers from 8:00 until nightfall. In order to continue with his business and speed up his production, he wants to purchase machines with his loan. In the future he wants to finish building his home, which is currently made of bamboo.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: machines

loans.name: María Rosa

texts.es:
La Señora María Rosa L. es socia del banco comunal Señoras de Taguan, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre, que  pertenece al cantón Sigsig, su gente se dedica a la elaboración de sombreros de paja toquilla, a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.
 
Doña María se dedica a la agricultura, siembra maíz para su consumo, también se dedica a la cría de animales como gallinas, cerdos Y cuyes que los vende en Gualaceo y también para su consumo.

La Señora María tiene 70 años, es viuda hace 28 años  y tiene  4 hijos mayores de edad que viven independientemente.Con el trabajo en su juventud ha logrado construir su casa propia.
 
Este es el tercer crédito que realiza el banco comunal y tiene una gran amistad con todas las señoras que forman parte de él. Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento.
 
Su sueño es seguir conservando su salud.
texts.en:
Señora María Rosa L. is a member of the Señoras de Taguan (Women of Taguan) communal bank. She lives in the community of the same name, which belongs to the Sigsig canton. Her people make their livings making panama hats, raising animals and in agriculture. Doña María makes her living in agriculture. She grows corn for her own use, and she also raisies animals, likes chickens, pigs and guinea pigs, which she sells in Gualaceo and also uses for her own consumption. Señora María is 70 years old. She has been a widow for 28 years and has 4 grown children who live independently from her. She has been able to build her own home, thanks to the hard work of her youth. This is her third loan with her communal bank. She has a great relationship with all the woman who are part of the communal bank. Her loan will be invested in the purchase of chickens and chicken feed. Her hope is to continue preserving her health.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Nancy Marlene

texts.es:
La Señora Nancy Marlene C. es socia del banco comunal Señoras de Taguan, vive en la comunidad de Taguan, que es perteneciente al cantón Sigsig, su gente se dedica a la elaboración de sombreros de paja toquilla, a la cría de animales y a la agricultura.
 
La Señora Nancy se dedica a los quehaceres de la casa, cría  ganado y vende la leche que obtiene, también cría cerdos, borregos, pollos, cuyes y vende sus animales en la feria de Gualaceo.

Doña Nancy es muy joven tiene de 21 años, es casada y tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad, su esposo se dedica a la construcción, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá compartiendo los gastos.
 
Este es su tercer crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, vitaminas y alimento para incrementar su negocio.
 
Su sueño es comprarse un terreno.
texts.en:
Nancy Marlene C. is a member of the Señoras de Taguan [Women of Taguan] community bank. She lives in the Taguan community, which belongs to the Sigsig canton, whose people make straw hats, raise animals and farm. Nancy does housework, raises livestock and sells the milk that she obtains. She also raises hogs, sheep and guinea pigs, and sells her animals in the Gualaceo market. Nancy is very young. She is 21, married and has one 3-year-old child. Her husband works in construction. She does not have her own home because she lives in her mother's home sharing the costs. This is her third loan and she will invest it in the purchase of chickens, vitamins and food to expand her business. Her dream is to buy herself a plot of land.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase chickens, vitamins and animal food.

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: Olga, de 38 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de sus 3 hijos menores de edad, y que aún estudian en el colegio, juntos y con muchas ganas de salir adelante habitan en un populoso barrio ubicado al norte de la ciudad. El día empieza muy temprano para esta emprendedora mujer, que no descansa para sacar adelante a su familia. Es así que desde hace 5 años se dedica a diversos negocios, y empezó con la venta de productos de belleza de una reconocida marca. El tiempo en el negocio y su carisma le han permitido captar varios clientes fijos que no dudan en comprarle seguido, pues también recomienda el producto que deben comprar. Además instaló  una pequeña vitrina surtida de golosinas en el restaurante de un familiar, y con este negocio también obtiene ganancias que le permiten ofrecerles a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida. Como es una mujer emprendedora que siempre esta en busca de nuevas oportunidades, para el futuro se proyecta instalar una tienda de venta de comestibles, de esta manera espera mejorar sus ganancias. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente,  pues no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Olga tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado, en la compra de mayor cantidad de productos de belleza, así como golosinas para abastecer su pequeño negocio.
texts.en:
Olga is 38 years old and she lives in her own home together with her 3 school-aged children. They live together in a populous district north of the city. She starts her days very early in the morning. She never stops looking to provide for her family. For the past 5 years she has endeavored in various businesses, having started out by selling beauty products of a well known brand name. In time her business grew and with her great charisma she captured many steady clients that buy from her regularly. She also makes recommendations on the best products to use. She set up a small stand stocked with snacks in a restaurant belonging to a family member. This business earns her a good income and it allows her to provide her children with a good quality of life. As a hard working woman she is always in search for new opportunities. In the future she plans on setting up a grocery store, in efforts to improve her earnings. This is the second loan she requests from MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is committed to making the payments on time. She does not want to disappoint the individuals that made these funds possible, funds that will allow her to keep advancing her business. Olga plans on investing these funds in the purchase of larger quantities of beauty products, as well as snacks to stock her small business.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Mario Ezequiel

texts.es: Mario Ezequiel se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos, desde hace más de 9 años, la ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda y domicilio, pues Mario es un hombre trabajador pues le gusta mucho el campo y su trabajo. El se gana vida de la manera más humilde con su negocio. El financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima necesaria como leche, cuajada, crema y queso. Mario todos los días se levanta temprano para realizar su trabajo por lo que tiene buscar el alimento diario para su familia.
texts.en:
Mario Ezequiel has sold dairy products for over 9 years. His business is located in his home. Mario is a hard-working man who really likes the countryside and his work. He makes his living in a very humble way with his business. This loan is for the purchase of necessary basic material such as milk, curds, cream and cheese. Every day Mario gets up early to work, since he has to work for his family's daily bread.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia de 33 años vende leche. Ella comenzó porque su esposo se dedica a la venta de ganado. Inicio con  muy poca leche, pues no sabía si realmente iba a tener suficiente clientes pero gracias a la demanda de clientes y sus ahorros pudo estabilizar su negocio. Sus hijos le ayudan a realizar ciertas tareas del hogar mientras que ella atiende el local. Con el préstamo quiere comprar más leche para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes que llegan temprano a su local. En el futuro quiere ampliar su negocio y además mejorar cada día la atención.
texts.en:
Julia, age 33, sells milk. She started this because her husband sells cattle. She started with very little milk, and she did not know if she would really have enough customers. However, thanks to her customers' demand and her savings she was able to establish her business. Her children help her to do certain jobs in the home while she tends to the business. With this loan she wants to buy more milk to satisfy the demand of the customers who arrive at her business early. In the future she wants to expand her business and improve her customer service every day.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es: Herlinda, de 51 años, vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus 4 hijos, de los cuales la mayor ya trabaja, mientras ella se hace cargo de los demás, juntos y con muchas ganas de salir adelante habitan en un barrio ubicado a orillas del mar. Desde que se separo de su pareja trabajo sin cesar para sacar adelante a sus hijos. Y en la actualidad puede decir orgullosa que lo esta logrando, a base de mucho trabajo. El día de esta laboriosa mujer empieza a las 5 de la mañana, cuando se despierta para preparar los desayunos que ofrece a sus comensales, que en la gran mayoría son trabajadores de una empresa de transporte, y los reparte ella sola, luego ya en la tarde lleva comidas que reparte entre sus clientes. Como ofrece deliciosos platillos a buen precio, es muy solicitada, ya que algunos clientes le pagan al crédito, y les cobra semanalmente, lo que le permite obtener buenas ganancias. Y como es una mujer emprendedora para mas adelante tiene planeado instalar un restaurante, para trabajar más tranquila en un lugar fijo. Es el cuarto crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar puntualmente sus cuotas pues no quiere decepcionar a las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Herlinda tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de ingredientes al por mayor que necesita para seguir cocinando y ofrecerles lo mejor a sus asiduos comensales.
texts.en:
Herlinda is 51 years old and she lives in her own home together with her 4 children, the eldest already has a job and she takes care of her younger siblings. The live together in an ocean side region. Since she separated from her partner she has worked incessantly to provide for her children. Proudly she can now say that she has managed to support her kids, a product of so much work. The days of this hard working woman start at 5 in the morning. When she wakes she gets breakfast ready for her clients. In the afternoons she takes prepared foods and distributes them to her various clients, the large majority of them are workers of a transport company. She distributes the foods by herself and in the afternoons she takes the foods to her various clients. She makes delicious foods and she sells them at a good price, so she is very sought out. Some clients complete their sales in credit and she collects payments on a weekly basis, an arrangement that garners a good income for her. She is a business woman so her plans for the future are to set up a restaurant to be able to work in one place. This is her fourth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is committed to making the payments, as she does not wish to disappoint the individuals that make this loan possible. These funds will let her keep advancing her business. Herlinda plans to invest this loan in the purchase of ingredients in wholesale, necessary to keep cooking her foods and selling to her esteemed clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to prepare foods.

loans.name: Rosa Matilde

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa Matilde C. es socia del banco comunal El Tocte, vive en la comunidad Vegaspamba, que pertenece a la parroquia de Jadan,  la mayor parte de su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, también salen a la ciudad para trabajar en diferentes áreas como en la construcción, en fabricas etc.

Doña Rosa tiene 36 años, es casada y tiene 5 hijos de 18, 16, 14, 9 y 7 años de edad. Sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y ayudan  económicamente, su tercer hijo  estudia en el colegio y sus dos últimos hijos en la escuela. Su esposo trabaja en el área de la construcción ya que es maestro albañil y gracias al trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora Rosa se dedica a la agricultura, siembra hortalizas las que vende en la feria libre en la ciudad, también  cría de animales como  cerdos, cuyes y pollos que los  vende en la feria del ganado.
 
Este es su séptimo crédito que realiza en la banca comunal y ha llegado a tener una gran amistad con todas las compañeras que lo conforman. Su nuevo crédito lo a va a invertir en la compra de pollos y en el alimento para sus cerdos.
 
Su meta es  crecer con su negocio de animales.
texts.en:
Señora Rosa Matilde C. is a member of the El Tocte communal bank. She lives in the Vegaspamba community, which belongs to Jadan Parrish. The majority of her people make their livings raising animals and in agriculture. They also leave for the city to work in different areas, like construction and in factories etc. Doña Rosa is 36 years old, married and has 5 children ages 18, 16, 14, 9 and 7. Her first two children work and help out financially. Her third child is in high school, and the last two are in elementary school. Her husband works in construction, since he is a master bricklayer. Thanks to his profession, they have been able to build their own home. Señora Rosa makes her living in agriculture. She plants vegetables which she sells in the free market in the city. She also raises animals, like pigs, guinea pigs and chickens, which she sells in the livestock market. This is her seventh loan with her communal bank, and she has come to build great friendships with all the women who are part of the communal bank. Her new loan will be invested in the purchase of chickens and pig feed. Her goal is to grow her business raising animals.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase chickens and feed for pigs.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
La Señora María Magdalena M. es socia del banco comunal El Tocte, vive en la comunidad de Vegaspamba que pertenece a la parroquia de Jadan,  la mayor parte de su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, también salen a la ciudad para trabajar en diferentes áreas como en la construcción, en fábricas etc.

Doña María tiene 43 años, es casada y tiene 7 hijos de 26, 22, 21, 19, 17, 15 y 13 años de edad. Sus tres primeros hijos son casados, solo su hija casada  vive con ella y comparten gastos, sus hijos de 19 y 17 años trabajan y ayudan en la economía del hogar, sus dos últimos hijos estudian en el colegio. Su esposo es maestro albañil y el trabajo en conjunto les ha permitido construir su casa propia.

La Señora María trabaja hace 6 meses como empleada domestica 3 días a la semana sin horario fijo, los demás días se dedica a su invernadero que ya lo tiene dos años y medio en donde siembra tomates, también se dedica a la cría de cuyes, cerdos y gallinas  que son para su consumo o los vende cuando tiene laguna necesidad económica.

Es una socia que tiene una gran amistad con todas las socias. Este es el séptimo crédito que realiza y lo va  a invertir en la compra de  plantas de tomate para su invernadero.
texts.en:
María Magdalena M. is a member of the El Tocte community bank. She lives in the Vegaspamba community which belongs to the Jadan parish. The majority of its people raise animals and work in agriculture. They also leave for the city to work in different areas such as construction, in factories, etc. Maria is 43, married and has 7 children ages 26, 22, 21, 19, 17, 15 and 13. Her three oldest children are married, but her married daughter lives with her and shares costs. Her 19 and 17 year-old children work and help with the household costs. Her two youngest children are in school. Her husband is a master builder and working together has allowed them to build their own home. Maria has worked as a maid for 6 months. She works 3 days a week without a fixed schedule. On the other days she works in her greenhouse which she has had for two and a half years, where she sows tomatoes. She also raises guinea pigs, hogs and hens for consumption or sells them when she has any economic need. She is a borrower who has strong friendships with all of the other bank members. This is her seventh loan and she will invest it in the purchase of tomato plants for her greenhouse.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase tomato plants

loans.name: Romulo

texts.es:
Romulo es socio del Banco Comunal Proyección.
Romulo es conviviente, tiene 6 hijos y solo una hija de 9 años esta a su responsabilidad además de un nieto de 3 años, Romulo se dedica a la venta de artefactos eléctricos de importación que compra en aduana, la venta lo realiza al por mayor a las diferentes tiendas. Además Romulo junto a su pareja tienen una tienda de alquiler de vestidos de novias, decoraciones de locales.
Romulo necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles para el pago de transporte de los artefactos.
Romulo sueña con construir su casa en la ciudad de Ayacucho ya tiene su terreno, actualmente vive en casa alquilada y brindar una buena educación a su hija y nieto.
texts.en:
Romulo is a member of the community bank Proyección (Projection). Romulo lives with his partner. He has six children. Now only a daughter who is 9 and a grandson who is 3 are his responsibility. Romulo works in the sale of imported electrical appliances, which he buys at the customs house. He sells them wholesale to different stores. In addition, Romulo and his partner have a store where they rent wedding dresses and decorations. Romulo needs a loan of 3000 PEN to pay for the transport of appliances. Romulo dreams of constructing a house in the city of Ayacucho. He already has a piece of land. He now lives in a rented house. He also dreams of offering a good education to his daughter and his grandson.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for the transportation of appliances.

loans.name: Nancy Carolina

texts.es:
Nancy es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos que estudian, Nancy vende ropa variada en las diferentes ferias de la región a donde viaja 4 veces a la semana, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Además Nancy tiene un carro con la cual realizan transporte urbano en la ciudad de Ayacucho.
Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Proyección y solicita un crédito para la compra de conjuntos de niños y pantalones.
Los sueños de Nancy son tener casa propia pues vive en casa alquilada y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Nancy lives with her partner and has 2 children who study. Nancy sells assorted clothing in the markets in the region, to which she travels 4 times a week. She acquires her products in the city of Lima. Nancy has a car for urban transportation to the city of Ayacucho. Nancy is a member of the Proyeccion Community Bank and is requesting a loan for the purchase of sets of children's clothing and pants. Nancy's dreams are to have her own home, since she lives in a rented house, and for her children to be professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of sets of children's clothing and pants.

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es soltera, tiene 51 años y 4 hijos de los cuales solo una vive con ella y estudia en el colegio, Isabel vende agregados en un local alquilado, vende productos como arena, ladrillos, productos que trae del río con un carro alquilado, sus ventas son al por mayor y menos cuenta con un carro pequeño para el reparto. Además Isabel hace ladrillos artesanalmente en la comunidad de Compañía también compra de productores para comercializarlos en Ayacucho.
Isabel es socia del Banco Comunal Proyección y  solicita un préstamo de 3000 soles para la compra de arena fina y ladrillos.
Isabel sueña con comprar un volquete, tener una ferretería y que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
Isabel is single. She is 51 and has 4 children. Now only one, who is in school, lives with her. Isabel sells building materials in a rented location. She sells products such as sand, bricks, and construction products which she brings from the river in a rented car. She makes wholesale sales and has a small car for the deliveries. In addition, Isabel makes traditional brick in the town of Compañía. She also buys products to sell in Ayacucho. Isabel is a member of the community bank Proyección (Projection) and is applying for a loan of 3000 PEN for the purchase of fine sand and bricks. Isabel dreams of buying a dump truck, having a hardware store, and for her daughter to have a career.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fine sand and bricks.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es:
Lucy pertenece al Banco Comunal Proyección.
Lucy es soltera, tiene 52 años y 6 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian, Lucy vende pescados en el terminal pesquero de la ciudad de Ayacucho, actividad que realiza los días sábados, y los días domingos viaja a la ciudad de Andahuaylas. Además Lucy vende jugos de frutas en su casa los días lunes por realizarse una feria de ropa.
Lucy necesita un préstamo de 2500 soles para la compra de pescados.
Los sueños de Lucy son que sus dos ultimas hijas sean profesionales y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Lucy belongs to the Proyección communal bank. Lucy is single, 52 years old and has 6 children. Two of her children are in school. Lucy sells fish in the fish terminal of Ayacucho, an activity that she carries out every Saturday. On Sundays she travels to Andahuaylas. In addition, Lucy sells fruits juices from her home on Mondays for a clothing market she puts on. Lucy needs a loan of 2500 PEN ($900 USD) to purchase fish. Lucy hopes that her youngest two daughters can become professionals, and she hopes to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fish.

loans.name: Rigoberta

texts.es:
Rigoberta pertenece al Banco Comunal Proyección.
Rigoberta es casada, tiene 5 hijos de los cuales 2 viven con ella, Rigoberta tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende carne, Rigoberta viaja a las ferias a comprar los animales. Además Rigoberta tiene un recreo en su casa llamado El Tambo en donde vende comida típica, actividad que realiza los días sábados y domingos.
Rigoberta solicita un crédito de 1000 soles para la compra de ganado.
Los sueños de Rigoberta son que sus dos hijas sean profesionales y tener mas capital.
texts.en:
Rigoberta belongs to the Proyección communal bank. Rigoberta is married and has 5 children, 2 of whom live with her. She has a stall in the 12 de Abril (April 12th) market where she sells meat. She travels to other markets to purchase the animals. In addition, Rigoberta has a patio in her house called El Tambo where she sells traditional food on Saturdays and Sundays. Rigoberta is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN ($375 USD) to purchase livestock. Rigoberta hopes that her two daughters can become professionals, and she hopes to have more capital.

Translated from Spanish by Marni Siegal, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of livestock.

loans.name: Elvira De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora Elvira de Jesús T. es socia del banco comunal El Tocte, vive en la comunidad que lleva el mismo nombre y pertenece a la parroquia de Jadan,  la mayor parte de su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, también salen a la ciudad para trabajar en diferentes áreas como en la construcción, en fabricas etc.

Doña Elvira tiene 46 años, es soltera y tiene 3 hijos de 22, 15 y 9 años  a los cuales ella sola los ha educado y les ha sacado adelante. Su primer hijo es casado y vive independiente, su segundo hijo trabaja y ayuda económicamente y su último hijo estudia en la escuela. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en una casa que le dan donde trabaja.

La Señora. Elvira trabaja hace 6 años cuidando una finca y criando animales como ganado, cuyes, chanchos y borregos, labora de domingo a domingo sin horario. También tiene tiempo para criar chanchos, cuyes, gallinas que son de su propiedad y vende en su comunidad.
 
Este  es el tercer crédito que realiza en la fundación, fue invitada por su sobrina a formar parte de este  grupo de mujeres luchadoras, lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes.
 
Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio de  animales.
texts.en:
Elvira de Jesús T. is a member of El Tocte communal bank, she lives in a community that goes by the same name. She belongs to the Jadan parish whose members mainly work in agriculture and raise livestock but they also work in different sectors in the city like construction, factory work, etc.. Elvira is a 46 year old single woman with three children of ages: 22, 15, and 9 years old whom she has personally educated and has helped them get ahead. Her eldest son is married and lives on his own, her second son works and helps out financially, and her youngest is still in school. She doesn't own her home it is provided to her by her employer. Elvira has been working at an estate raising cattle, guinea pigs, hogs, and sheep for 6 years. She works everyday without a fixed schedule and still has time to raise her own hogs, guinea pigs, and chickens that she sells to the community. This is her third loan with the organization and was asked by her niece to form part of this group of fighting women. She will invest the loan to purchase guinea pigs. Her goal is to continue to grow her animal business.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase guinea pigs

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo de 6 años, Mercedes junto a su esposo se dedican a la fabricación de ladrillos artesanales en la comunidad de Compañía, sus productos los comercializan en la misma comunidad.
Mercedes pertenece al Banco Comunal Proyección y solicita un crédito de 1000 soles para la compra de leña.
Mercedes sueña con tener casa propia pues vive en la casa de su suegra y tener un negocio estable.
texts.en:
Mercedes is in a common law marriage and has a six year old child. She and her husband produce handmade bricks in the community of Compañía. Her products are sold in the same community.

Mercedes belongs to the Communal Bank “Proyección” (Projection) and is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN to buy firewood. She dreams of having a home of her own since she lives at her mother-in-law’s house. In addition, she hopes to have a stable business.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase firewood

loans.name: Mariana Del Rocío

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

La señora Mariana tiene 29 años, está  separada y con tres hijos a su cargo su vida es muy difícil, a pesar de que sus padres le apoyan ya que viven en la casa de ellos, los gastos de alimentación y estudio de sus hijos son de ella.
 
Por esta razón es por lo que ella trabaja y se sacrifica, vende bisutería y artículos de belleza, sale a entregar todas las tardes, compra al por mayor en Portoviejo, deja a crédito sus productos y cobra semanalmente.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar mas mercadería. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace varios años y le gustan los beneficios que ofrece la Fundación Espoir.
 
Su sueño es tener un  negocio grande para poder darles lo mejor a sus pequeños hijos.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora Communal Bank meets in Sequita parish, which is part of the prosperous canton of Manabita. The hardworking people of this area are dedicated and proud of their roots. The residents of Sequita are honest people who know only how to work and dedicate themselves to their families.

Sra. Mariana is 29 years old and separated from her spouse. With three children to raise, her life is very difficult. Despite living at home with her parents and receiving their support, she must still cover the costs associated with feeding and educating her children.

For this reason, Mariana has worked and sacrificed by selling trinkets and beauty products. She travels every afternoon to deliver her products. Mariana buys in bulk in Portoviejo and then sells the products on credit, collecting payments on a weekly basis.

This loan will be used to buy more merchandise. She has been a member of her Communal Bank for several years and enjoys the benefits offered by Fundación ESPOIR.

Her dream is to have a large business so that she can provide the best for her young children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase crèmes, cosmetics, perfumes, trinkets, and other items

loans.name: Nimia Graciana

texts.es:
L a señora Nimia hace varios años que es socia del Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora que se reúne cada 15 días en la  parroquia la Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro.

Ella tiene 58 años tuvo una relación de unión libre, de la cual procreo 5 hijos todos mayores de edad pero uno vive con ella, en la actualidad esta separada y vive en la casa de sus padres que ya son fallecidos.

Tiene una mini tienda de víveres de consumo, trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 20h00, le ayuda su hijo cuando tiene que ir a comprar sus productos los cuales los compra en Portoviejo y Manta, aunque algunos productos los recibe en su tienda.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar  mesas  y sillas para comodidad de sus clientes ya que también vende bebidas alcohólicas como (cerveza).

Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y ampliar su tienda.
texts.en:
Sra. Nimia has been a member of the María Auxiliadora Communal Bank for several years. The members meet every 15 days in the parish of Sequita in Montecristi, a canton known as the birthplace of the “Old Warrior” Eloy Alfaro.

She is 53 years old and in a common law marriage. Nimia has five grown children, but only one still lives with her. She is currently separated from her spouse and lives at the house of her deceased parents.

Nimia has a convenience store where she sells consumer products. She works every day from 6am until 8pm. Her son helps out whenever she has to travel to Portoviejo and Manta to buy products. However, some of her merchandise is shipped to her store.

This loan will be used to buy tables and chairs so that her customers will be comfortable. She plans to sell alcoholic beverages such as beer. Her dreams are to continue working and expanding her store.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase tables & chairs

loans.name: Melva Lucelina

texts.es:
L a señora Melva es socia fundadora  del Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora y le gusta porque siempre le han ayudado mucho,  este Banco se reúne cada 15 días en la  parroquia la Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro.

Tiene 50 años, esta casada hace 28 años de la cual tuvo 6 hijos los que ahora ya son mayores de edad, uno de ellos falleció hace varios años, ella vive junto a su esposo y su hijo menor que aun vive con ella, su esposo es electricista.

Tiene un depósito de gas, atiende su negocio todos los días desde las 6am. hasta la noche ya que siempre está atenta  a recibir a sus clientes a toda hora ya que su negocio lo tiene en su propia casa, su hijo le ayuda en su negocio ya que es un poco pesado, ella va a comprar las bombonas de gas a la distribuidora general en Montecristi. Nos cuenta que le ha ido muy bien ya que no hay muchos negocios en su sector que se dediquen a esto.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar botellas y liquido (gas). Sus metas son seguir trabajando en su negocio y que este crezca.
texts.en:
Melva is a founding member of the Maria Auxiliadora communal bank and likes it very much because they have helped her a lot. The group meets every 15 days at the parrish church La Sequita of Montecristi, a canton recognized for being the birthplace of the old fighter, Eloy Alfaro. She is 50 years old and has been married for 28 of them and has 6 children who are now all grown, one of them passed away several years ago. She lives with her husband who is an electriciain and her youngest son who still lives with them. She has a gas deposit and tends to her business everyday from 6AM until nightfall since she always serves clients at whatever hour and her business is run from home. Her son helps her tend to the business but since he is slightly overweight she goes to purchase the gas tanks from the distributor in Montecristi. She tells us that it has been going good for her due to the fact that not too many businesses in the area offer her services. She will use this loan to purchase tanks and gasoline. Her goals are to continue working on her business and making it grow.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase gas tanks

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en: Ma. Fe B. is a married woman who lives in FZO Subdivision, Brgy 1, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She operates three business ventures to support her family. She operates a general store, runs a boarding house and has a fish-vending business that is managed by her husband, Ernesto. They have two children, 23 and 31 years old. Both are already working and self-supporting. Ma. Fe joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past seven loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma. Fe has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 16,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 19,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her eighth loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500. She intends to use it as additional capital for her general store and other businesses, so that she can continue to save up for the future security of her family. Ma. Fe B. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Purchase of additional stock to sell

loans.name: Marialou

texts.en: Marialou A. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 27 years old. Marialou is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Marialou runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily-use products and also dried fish in the local community. Marialou has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 9,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Marialou joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marialou is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Marialou from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Lorena Mariana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

La señora Lorena esta en su quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le ha gustado por las facilidades que le han dado para obtener  los créditos. Tiene 27 años y esta casada hace 8 años, de  esta  relación tiene 3 hijos todos son menores de edad, los dos mayores  están estudiando en la escuela.
 
Ella junto a su esposo tienen un negocio de venta de frutas y legumbres, trabajan desde la madrugada hasta la tarde, ella vende en su casa ya que tiene un pequeño puesto y su esposo recorre la ciudad de Manta en un triciclo los martes jueves y viernes, ella dice que antes acompañaba a su esposo en sus recorridos pero ahora que sus hijos están en la escuela no puede porque tiene que ayudarlos y cuidarlos, los productos los compran en Portoviejo, porque allá se consiguen más baratos.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar frutas verduras y otros productos para su negocio y el de su esposo.

Sus sueños son terminar su casa y poner una tienda.
texts.en:
The communal bank of Maria Auxiliadora meets at the Sequita church parrish part of Montecristi a prosperous Manabí canton full of hard-working dedicated people who are proud of their roots. La Sequita is a parrish whose members are honest and all they know is work and family. Lorena is in her fifth term with the communal bank and she has enjoyed it due to the ease of obtaining her loans. She is 27 years old and has been married for 8 years, a marriage that produced 3 children. All her children are minors and the two eldest are in school. She and her husband own a business selling fruits and vegetables and they work from sunrise until dusk. She sells from home where she has a small stand and her husband sells all throughout the city of Manta on a tricycle every Tuesday, Thursday, and Friday. She states that she used to accompany her husband on these runs but can't now that her kids are in school because she has to help them and look after them. They purchase their produce in Portoviejo because they are cheaper there. She will use this loan to purchase fruits and vegetables and other products for their business. Her dream is to finish her home and set up a store.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase oranges, bananas, papayas, mandarines, tomatoes, ettuce, carrots, etc.

loans.name: Sin Narong

texts.en: Mrs. Sin Narong D. was born in 1984 in Kdei Ta Hok village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Choeurn Chuon, are farmers who own a 1.4-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support their family. Her husband also owns an agric machine. She has a problem because it is time to grow rice but she does not have any rice seeds. So, to improve production, Mrs. Sin Narong D. is seeking a loan to buy rice seeds. She will use the rest of the loan to buy a motor. She is a mother of two children who are too small to work or study. Her husband is in the photo with her.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony N. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 24 years old and single. To make a living, Anthony owns and operates a specialized retail store buying and selling seafood products, such as salted and dried fish, in the local community. Anthony has been engaged in his business for over a year and earns approximately 2,500 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Anthony joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anthony is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional salted fish to sell. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional salted fish to sell

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: Mercedes O. is a married woman who lives in Phase I-C, Brgy. Canturay, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a general store and a rice-selling business. Her husband Vergillo O., who is 58 years old, works as a security guard to earn his living, and also helps with his wife's business activities. They have three children who range in age from 23 to 36 years old. Mercedes joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mercedes has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 11,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 20th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, which she intends to use to buy more goods such as fertilizers, insecticides and groceries to resell in her sari-sari (general) store so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs. Mercedes O. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable") woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team: http://www.kiva.org/team/nwtf_philippines

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Letty Diana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces, La Sequita es una parroquia donde sus habitantes son gente honesta que solo saben trabajar y dedicarse a sus familias.

La señora Letty esta en el Banco Comunal hace seis años y está muy a gusto porque los intereses son mínimos, ella tiene 42 años esta casada y tiene 4 hijos, tres de los cuales viven con ella a pesar de que son mayores de edad, también tiene una nieta de 1 año que vive con ella y dice que es su princesa. Su esposo es albañil.

Se dedica a la venta de sabanas y a la cría de pollos, tiene una pequeña granja, trabaja todos los días en el cuidado y alimentación de sus pollos,  la venta de sabanas las realiza los sábados y domingos, trabaja unas cinco horas entregando y cobrando ya que deja a crédito. Compra las sabanas en Picoaza, en cuanto a los pollos los compra en una incubadora y después de tres meses los entrega en tiendas de la localidad.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar mitad en sabanas y la otra parte en pollos.

Su sueño es terminar su casa ya que le falta mucho.
texts.en:
The Maria Auxiliadora communal bank meets at the La Sequita church parish that is part of Montecristi, a prosperous Manabí canton full of hard-working dedicated people who are proud of their roots. La Sequita is a parish whose members are people who only know of work and family. Letty has been with this communal bank for 6 years and is very satisfied due to the low interest. She is 42 years old, married, and has 4 children three of which still live with her despite being adults. She also has a 1 year old granddaughter she calls her princess who also lives with her. Her husband works as a mason. Letty sells bed sheets and raises chicks on her small farm. She works everyday feeding and caring for her chicks, she sells her sheets on Saturdays and Sundays, and spends about 5 hours delivering and collecting since she sells on credit. Letty purchases sheets in Picoaza and buys the chicks from a hatchery and after three months she delivers them to local stores. She will use half the loan to purchase sheets and the other half for chicks. Her dream is to finish her house that still has a long way to go.

Translated from Spanish by Gustavo Gutierrez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bedsheets and chickens

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena O. is a single woman who lives in Prk. Lupni, Brgy. Hilamonan, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: pig fattening, rice farming and retailing, and general store businesses. Magdalena joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Magdalena has been gradually lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 9,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 15,000 PHP, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing 16,000 PHP, which she intends to use as additional working capital for her business activities – pig fattening, rice farming and general store – so that she is able to continue to save up for future family needs and business reasons. Magdalena O. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva and joining our team.

loans.use: As additional working capital for her businesses

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
Mr. Yan T. is a rattan cupboard seller who is a 40-year-old, married father with two dependent children. One of his children is already married and lives independently, and the other two are single. Since 2006, 

Yan T. and his wife have owned a small rattan cupboard sales point. The couple also orders rattan items in bulk from braiders and then takes it to sell door-to-door across the province. 

Yan T. resides in an old house that needs repairs frequently. Because of that, Yan T. decided to seek for a loan to mend his house. 

(Mr. Yan T.'s wife is in the photo.)

loans.use: To repair his home.

loans.name: Hun

texts.en: Miss Hun N. was born in 1979 and lives in Prey Khvav village in Takeo province. She owns a general store in local village where she is able to earn a large profit to support her family. Now she has a lot of free time so she wants to start a new business, but she dioes not have enough money to support it. So Miss Hun N. is applying for a loan to buy a cow to breed. With the rest of the loan, she will buy pig food and two piglets to breed. She is single and lives with four household members.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana Y. is a 47-year-old, married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures: a tricycle passenger transport, Avon (Beauty Products) dealership and the buying and selling of Batad (shells). She lives in the village of Baod, Bantayan, Cebu. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business ventures, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10000. Juana is now borrowing PHP 29500 so that she can have some repairs and maintenance done on her motorcycle/tricycle unit and have some left over to use as additional working capital for her other businesses.  

This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 26000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Juana aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 


About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 
Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Maintenance of Motorcycle

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jesús Lucinda

texts.es:
L a señora Jesús  es socia fundadora  del Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora y le gusta porque siempre aprende mas en las reuniones. Este Banco se reúne cada 15 días en la  parroquia la Sequita de Montecristi, cantón conocido como la cuna  del viejo luchador Eloy Alfaro.

Tiene 42 años de edad, casada hace 20 años y tiene 4 hijos uno ya es mayor de edad pero todos viven en su casa y estudian en colegio y Universidad. Su esposo se dedica a la albañilería.

Se dedica a la cría de chanchos, los mismos que los compra cuando aun están pequeños, los tiene por espacio de tres a cuatro meses hasta que tengan un peso adecuado y luego los faena y lleva la carne al mercado a vender, esto lo realiza una o dos veces por semana, y en el cuidado y alimentación de sus chanchos trabaja dos horas por día todos los días, aquí le ayudan sus hijos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar dos puercas que están preñadas, en el alimento y medicinas para su crecimiento.
 
Sus sueños son que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y que sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Señora Jesús is a founding member of the community bank Maria Auxiliadora, and she likes the community bank because she always learns more in the meetings. This bank meets every 15 days in the Sequita de Montecristi parish, a district known as the birthplace of the old revolutionary Eloy Alfaro. She is 42 years old. She has been married for 20 years and has 4 children. One is already an adult, but all of them live with her and study in secondary school or university. Her husband works in masonry. She raises pigs, which she buys when they are still little. She has them for three to four months until they have adequate weight and then she butchers them and takes the meat to the market to sell. She does this once or twice a week. She works two hours every day in the care and feeding of her pigs, and in this way she helps her children. She will use this loan to buy two sows that are pregnant and the food and medicines for their growth. Her dream is that her children finish their studies and have good careers.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy two sows, food, and medicine

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita S. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 58 years old. Teresita has seven adult-aged children and is separated from her spouse. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a specialized retail store buying and selling of sand and gravel for construction purposes in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory

location.town: Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Ori

loans.name: Kaem

texts.en:
Mrs. Kaem S. is 47 years old and lives in Tnaot Chum village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land in which to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. She also sells tamarind door-to-door. 

She is a widow with four children, two of whom are seamstresses in a garment factory, while the others are farmers. Although she tries to work a lot, she can earn very little money to support her family. So to improve this condition, Mrs. Kaem S. is seeking a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Lach

texts.en:
Mrs. Lach K. is a rattan cupboard producer who is a 45-year-old, married mother caring for three kids, while another two of her children are already married and live away from home. 

Lach K. and her husband have had a small rattan cupboard investment, since early 2005. This couple also orders rattan items in bulk from braiders and then takes them to sell directly at their client’s house. They always get outside of their house to sell their products around their community. 

Recently, Lach K. got orders for rattan from her customer but her stock is not enough to serve them. In order to better satisfy the needs of the customers, Lach K. seeks a loan to stock a larger amount of rattan cupboards to sell.

loans.use: To stock a bigger amount of rattan cupboards to sell.

loans.name: Chheoun's Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people make up a village bank loan located in Svay Prey village, Kandal province. Chheoun P. is a 38-year-old married woman. She is the village bank president who was selected by the members of the village loan. With the loans, they will support their different purposes. 

Chheoun P. and her husband, Mr. Phum Sam Art, are duck breeders who are able to earn some profit to support their family. For supporting this business, Chheoun P. decided to ask for a loan to buy duck food for duck breeding. 

This couple has four children: One is a seamstress in a garment factory and another is a duck breeder, while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy duck food for duck breeding

loans.name: Nhanh

texts.en: Mrs. Nhanh R. was born in 1947 and lives in Tnaot Chum village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 2-hectare plot of land to cultivate rice to sell to support her family. Now she wants to breed a cow but she does not have enough money to buy a cow. So, for this purpose, Mrs. Nhanh R. is asking for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to start a new business. She is a widow with four children. Three of  the children are seamstresses in a garment factory and one is a mirror cutter.

loans.use: To buy a cow to breed

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon G. is a widow who lives in Sitio Pateno, village Bocana, Ilog, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a general store. She has two children who are aged 30 and 32. One already has a family and the other works and helps her in her business. 

Corazon joined NWTF-Project Dungganon because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Corazon has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 21000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4200, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 13th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19500, which she intends to use to buy more stock to sell in her general store so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs and her own security. 

Corazon G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means "honorable"). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.
Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team..

loans.use: Purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Ketty Viviana

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal María Auxiliadora se reúne en La parroquia Sequita, pertenece a Montecristi prospero cantón manabita, lleno de gente trabajadora dedicada y orgullosa de sus raíces.

La señora Ketty tiene 30 años de edad y está casada hace 13 años de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 12 y una linda niña de 5 años los cuales son su razón de vivir y salir adelante, el esposo es vendedor ambulante de aguas aromáticas en Manta.

Vende bisutería, ropa en general e interiores de damas, sale a recorrer con sus productos los fines de semana de cinco a seis horas, los otros días trabaja con su esposo en Manta. La mercadería  compra en Guayaquil, ciudad a la que viaja una o dos veces al mes de acuerdo a la demanda que tenga de sus productos. Lo que mas vende es interiores y ropa de damas.

Este crédito lo va emplear justamente en comprar interiores y ropa de damas ya que tiene algunos pedidos.
 
Hace 4 ciclos es socia del Banco Comunal y le gusta por la comodidad para pagar sus cuotas.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia ya que viven en la casa de sus padres.
texts.en:
Sequita belongs to Montecristi, a prosperous canton in the province of Manabí. Its inhabitants are hard-working, dedicated people who are proud of their roots. Ketty is 30 years old and has been married for 13 years. She has two 12-year-old twins and a beautiful 5-year-old daughter who are her reason for living and the reason she strives to get ahead in life. Her husband is a street vendor and sells aromatic waters in Manta. Ketty sells costume jewelry, clothing, and women’s undergarments. On weekends, she travels around for 5 to 6 hours selling her products. The rest of the week she works with her husband in Manta. Depending on the demand for her products, she travels to Guayaquil one or two times a month to buy merchandise. She sells mostly undergarments and women’s clothing. She will use this loan to buy undergarments and women’s clothing as she already has some orders. She has been a member of the communal bank for 4 loan cycles and likes the convenience of making her payments. Her dream is to have her own home as she presently lives with her parents.

Translated from Spanish by Eleanor Francoletti-Putz, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy undergarments and women's clothing.

loans.name: Markjil

texts.en:
Markjil P. is from the village of Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 25 years old. Markjil is single. To make a living, Markjil provides waste-management services. The main source of income for the business comes from hauling junk and other waste material for local businesses and community members. Markjil has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Markjil joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Markjil is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional plastics and other recyclables to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Markjil from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:
