loans.name: Mrs. Nhok Sam On Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of twelve people located in Rumchek village in Takeo province. Mrs. Nhok S. O., born in 1986, was chosen village bank president, selected by the other members who will each use their portiO. of the loan for different purposes. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice O. to sell to support her family and she is a weaver while her husband, Mr. Phech P., is a driver. 

Her problem is that her field has infertile soil. So, to improve productiO., Mrs. Nhok S. O. is applying for a loan to buy fertilizer. With the rest of the loan, she will hire a plow to plow her field. She is a mother of two children both of whom are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire a plow

loans.name: Shodigul

texts.ru: Каримова Шодигул проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 27 лет. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Образование среднее. Вместе с мужем занимается животноводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 4 года. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Shodigul K. lives in the city of Kulob. She is 27 years old, married and has 3 children. She has a secondary education. Together with her husband, she is involved in animal husbandry and breeds livestock at home. Shodigul has been involved in this business for 4 years. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
This village loan consists of twenty-three people, located in Toul Tnaot village in Kandal province. Mr. Kong S., born in 1971 and a married man, was selected as the village bank president by the members of this village bank loan. The members will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes. 

Mr. Kong S. is a farmer who owns a piece of land that he uses to cultivate vegetables for a living. He faces a problem because he does not have enough money to support his farm. Thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide to grow crops. His wife, Mrs. Chea Solom, is 38 years old and works as a seamstress in a garment factory where she receives a small salary to support her famiL.. This couple has four childrE.: Two are seamstresses in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide to grow crops

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Mrs. Seng P. is a 38-year-old married woman and a local villager living in a medium-sized home with family members in Kompong Tom Province. She owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She uses this land to grow different kinds of crops to ensure that her family maintains a good lifestyle. However, the family income is not enough to support them, and Seng P. wants to earn additional income. The loan she is requesting will allow her to buy piglets for a stall she has already built, so she can increase the profits from her business.

loans.use: To buy piglets

loans.name: Chea's Group

texts.en:
This group loan consists of four people, located in Preak Thmei village, Kandal province. Chea S. is a 42-year-old married woman and was selected as the leader of this group loan. With the loans, they are able to create a new business or to expand their present business to improve their families' living conditions. 

Chea S. is a pork seller in the local market whilest her husband, Mr. Morm Thoeun, 42 years old, works as a car driver. With both of their occupations, they are able to earn a small income to support their family. Their house presently does not have a lavatory, so Chea S. decided to ask for a loan to build a lavatory for family use. This couple has two children, who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To build a lavatory for family use

loans.name: Mr. Nuy Peng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people make up a village bank loan in Rumchek village in Takeo province. Mr. Nuy P. is the village bank president, born in 1952 and selected by the other members who will each use their loan for different purposes. He and his wife, Mrs. Hing Torn, are farmers who own a small piece of land to cultivate rice on to sell to support their family. He is also a rock breaker. 

His problE. is that his home is not comfortable to live in because his home does not have electric current. So, Mr. Nuy P. is applying for a loan to buy some electrical supplies. He is a father of three children, two of whom are seamstresses in garment factory, while the other is an air conditioner repairman.

loans.use: To buy some electrical supplies

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Mrs. Long L., age 35, is married with seven children: two are married and five are single. She has been a domestic rice planter since she was single. Sometimes she receives help growing crops from her husband. In addition, her husband works as a building laborer, moving from construction site to construction site around the province. 

Long L. has been planning to buy a plot of her neighbor’s farmland in a good place for growing, but her goal is not coming true due to lack of funds. To achieve the goal, Long L. would like a loan to buy the land where she will grow various crops for extra profit.

loans.use: To buy land to grow various crops

loans.name: Khatoon's Group

texts.en:
Khatoon, wife of M. A., resides in the mid-sized city Vehari in Pakistan. Vehari city is famous for its agricultural industry. 
Khatoon is a talented 28-year-old lady. She not only manages her household responsibilities but also handles her embroidery business well. She does this work to supplement the income of her family. She crafts beautiful designs on clothes and sells to neighboring areas and also in the clothes shops. She completes each dress in three days time and earns good money from it. Each dress brings in a profit of almost 400-500 Pakistani rupees (PKR) which helps her to pay off the utilities. Her husband has a business selling groceries and runs a grocery shop in the market. Although he doesn't have a big shop, he thinks that he is lucky enough that people come to him to buy groceries. He welcomes his clients with a good smile and treats them well.

Khatoon has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will put more groceries in his shop and fulfill the requirements of his customers.

Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Khatoon.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery shop

loans.name: Maria May

texts.en:
Being a mother, 57-year-old Maria May G. is very concerned about the lives of her two married children, as well as her own life and the well-being of her husband and the six children who still live with her and are dependent on her. Most of the family have an unstable source of income and are still under the umbrella of poverty. 

Instead of allowing herself to get stuck in the middle of the insecurities, in 2004, Maria May joined Kiva's field partner in the Philippines, ASHI, to access loans to enable her to be productive and flourish. She's used previous loans for her venture selling fish. The profits she makes augment her husband’s income as a fisherman. As soon as her business grows, she will be able to support her children's and grandchildren’s needs so they can enjoy the gifts of life. With this, her role as a mother will be completed. 

Maria May's membership in ASHI, and the loans she has received as a member, have assisted her in running her business. Maria May has been performing very well with her repayments, attendance, and business; thus qualifying her for a larger loan.

loans.use: To support her business selling fish

loans.name: Sam

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam R. is a 49-year-old farmer in her village in Kampong Tom Province. She earns an average of $2.50 per day. Her husband, Mr. Say Poch, is 56 years old and also works on the farm field with her. Sam R. has four children, two of whom work in the construction sector, while one is a tailor and another one is already married and lives separately. 

Sam R. faces difficulty traveling to the workplace or anywhere else, because she doesn’t have a vehicle. Because of this problem, Sam R. needs to take a loan to be used to buy a second-hand motorcycle to make family transportation easier.

loans.use: To buy a second-hand motorcycle to make family transportation easier

loans.name: Niyolbi

texts.ru: Шамсова Ниёлби проживает в городе Куляб. Возраст, 63 года. Вдова, имеет одного ребенка. Сын занимается торговлей. Сама Ниёлби имеет высшее образование, педагог. По профессии проработала более 25 лет. Сейчас она занимается торговлей. Арендует магазин, где продает продукты питания. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже 3 года. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота и приобретения швейной машинки для невестки.
texts.en:
Niyolbi S. lives in the city of Kulob. She is 63 years old, a widow and has one child. Her son is involved in retail sales. Niyolbi has a higher education as a teacher. She worked in her field for over 25 years. Currently, she is involved in retail sales. Niyolbi leases a store, where she sells food products. She has been in this business for 3 years. She is requesting this loan to increase product turnover and purchase a sewing machine for her daughter-in-law.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing turnover and purchase of a sewing machine.

loans.name: Jannat's Group

texts.en:
Jannat is 42 years old and married to M. H.. Both reside in a mid-sized city called Vehari, in Pakistan. Vehari city is famous for its agriculture industry.  

They are very simple and helping in nature. Jannat is purely a housewife and prefers to stay at home handling household chores and taking care of her family. She and her family have built their habit to wake up early in the morning. In this way, they stay fresh for a long time and do their work efficiently.  

Her husband is involved in the animal-selling business. He buys animals of a young age from the market, grows them up and then resells them to the required customers. He has been in this profession for the past 10 years. He keeps the animals at his house and takes care of them.  

Jannat also helps him by taking care of his animals by giving them timely food and water and keeping their place clean to avoid diseases.  

Jannat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount, her husband will buy young animals (goats and sheep) for his business. She is hopeful that this investment will prove successful for her husband’s business and his income will become double in size and her family’s living standards will become better. 

Note: In the photo, the lady who is slightly raising her hand is Jannat.

loans.use: To buy animals for reselling

loans.name: Rashmi

texts.en: This is 26-year-old Rashmi S.. She is married and has one 6-month-old child. In 2007, she established her shop business. Working seven days a week and seven hours a day, she supports her family. The loan from Patan BPW is to increase the inventory of her store. In the future, Rashmi plans to expand the business. She thanks you for your support. In the Kathmandu Valley, small grocery stores, called pasal, are an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce and shrewd businesswomen. This loan was administered by Kiva's local partner MFI, Patan Business and Professional Women. Patan BPW became Kiva's first field partner in Nepal in 2007. Patan BPW operates throughout the Kathmandu Valley, offering microcredit and business training programs to low-income women. In addition to providing economic opportunity to their clients, Patan BPW seeks to empower Nepali women within the home and community. For more information about Patan BPW, visit our partner page and keep an eye out for new loans and borrower updates: http://www.kiva.org/partners/62. Join our lending team: http://www.kiva.org/team/bpw_patan_nepal

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Ry

texts.en: Mr. Ry C. is a 49-year-old resident of Kompong Tom province. Ry C. has been working as a local cultivator for many years. He has a life partner in his wife (pictured above) who works with him in the farming business. Ry C. planted vegetables two months ago, but the crops are not growing well because they need fertilizer. To improve the crop, Ry C. is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer for his crops.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Kang

texts.en: Mr. S. is highly skilled at building stone and wooden houses. He has a few physical laborers to help him provide his service. He receives a lot of orders from his clients to construct their houses. He has another partner in his wife, who owns farmland that she uses to grow crops. S. has four children who are no longer in school. One of his children is employed and the other three are jobless. S. wants to encourage his unemployed children to have suitable jobs so he is requesting a loan for his children to use as capital to begin a tailoring service from home.

loans.use: To begin a tailoring service.

loans.name: Parveen's Group

texts.en:
Parveen is a 48-year-old woman who resides in a city called Vehari in Pakistan. Vehari city is famous for its agriculture industry.  She is a caring lady and prefers to stay at home and take care of her family. She cooks delicious food for her family so they stay healthy. She does not have a well-built house but she never complains to her husband and spends her life happily with him in the two-room brick house.  Her husband's name is N. A. and he is involved in an animal-selling business. He has been in this business for the past 10 years. He specifically deals with goats because his clientele base is butchers so he sells goats to them to earn a profit. He buys goats from the animal market at cheap rates and sells them at a good profit. Due to his good knowledge of animal breeds, his customers contact him to arrange animals for them. In this way, his family financial circle runs. 
Parveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy goats in bigger quantities and fulfill the orders of his customers. She is hopeful that this investment will prove beneficial for her husband and his income will double in size.  

Note: In the photo, the lady who is slightly raising her hand is Parveen.

loans.use: To buy goats to resell

loans.name: Kurbonmurod

texts.ru: Хасанов Курбонмурод проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст, 39 лет. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование средне - специальное, сварщик. По специальности проработал 5 лет. Сейчас он занимается торговлей. Имеет собственную торговую точку, где продает угль. Этим видом деятельности занимается 2 года. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота. Клиент хочет закупить в оптом угль, так как в это время года спрос на его товар увеличивается.
texts.en:
Kurbonmurod H. lives in the Varzob district. He is 39 years old, married and has 4 children. He has a secondary-specialized education as a welder. He worked in that field for 5 years. Currently, Kurbonmurod is involved in sales. He owns a retail outlet, where he sells coal. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. He is requesting this loan in order to increase goods tunover. The client wants to buy coal wholesale because the demand on his goods increases this time of year.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing goods turnover

loans.name: Rizalde

texts.en:
Rizalde G. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. He is 28 years old. Rizalde is married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Rizalde owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Rizalde has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Rizalde joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rizalde has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rizalde is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Rizalde from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Sugran's Group

texts.en:
Sugran is a wife of A. D. and resides in a city called Vehari, in Pakistan. Vehari city is famous for its agriculture industry. A very talented Sugran owns & operates her embroidery business. She does this work at her home and receives orders from her neighboring clients. She completes each dress in three to four days and earns a good profit. Her income helps her to share the financial burden with her husband. Her husband respects her for this caring attitude. 
 
A. D. is a milkman by profession. He owns a buffalo from which he gets about 8-10 kg of milk and sells 1kg milk for 45 PKRs. His daily earning is 450 PKRs. He sells milk to his community, but now the different milk-shop owners are asking him to supply milk to their shops as well. Therefore, Sugran has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for this purpose. With the loan, her husband will buy another buffalo, which will enable him to accept their offer to sell milk to their shops. She is hopeful that by accepting these offers and by investing the loan in her husband’s business, the day is not far when her husband will be able to start his own milk shop with his own clientele and enjoy selling milk to them.  

Note: "In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Sugran".

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for milk-selling business

loans.name: Concordia

texts.en:
Concordia T. is from the village of Salay, Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years old. Concordia is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Concordia owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Concordia has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 7,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Concordia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Concordia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Concordia is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Concordia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna A. is from the village of Kabulawan, Lagonglong, Misamis Oriental. She is 48 years old. Lorna is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Lorna owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Lorna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Lorna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Jinky

texts.en:
Jinky P. is from the village of Tipolohon, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She is 34 years old. Jinky is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Jinky owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Jinky has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Jinky joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jinky has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Jinky is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Jinky from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Mila Rose

texts.en:
Mila Rose D. is a 38-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business ventures:  selling meat and selling vegetables and spices. She lives in Brgy. 2, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2001 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her meat vending and vegetables and spices vending activities, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 6,500 PHP. Mila Rose is now borrowing 27,000 PHP to continue to fund operations of her meat, vegetables and spices vending activities.  This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 27,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Mila Rose aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org.

loans.use: To fund operations of her businesses

loans.name: Retchie

texts.en:
Retchie R. is from the village of Kabulawan, Lagonglong, Misamis Oriental. She is 25 years old. Retchie is separated from her spouse and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, Retchie owns & operates a business buying and selling bananas in the local community. Retchie has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Retchie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Retchie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional bananas to sell. Retchie is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Retchie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa L. is from the village of Igpit, Luz Banzon, Jasaan,  Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old. Elsa is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Elsa owns & operates a business providing motorcycle or habal-habal services to local community members. Her husband is the driver. Elsa has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Elsa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Elsa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Parveen Akhter's Group

texts.en:
Parveen Akhter lives in a historic city in Pakistan called Lahore. Lahore is the second largest city of Pakistan and is known for its history and culture. 
She is a 31-year-old lady who has been married to 39-year-old G. H. for the last 13 years. She is the mother of three daughters and two sons and lives in a three-room brick house with her family in an area named Mughalpura. Her husband is a rickshaw driver by profession. He provides transport facilities to his clients. Parveen supports her family financially by sewing clothes for her neighboring clients. She found the need to do this work a few years ago when she observed that her husband’s income alone was not enough to fulfill the basic needs of the family. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband. With the loan, he will buy a new rickshaw because his current rickshaw has become old and he cannot work with it for long hours. Parveen is hopeful that her husband will be able to increase his income by purchasing a new rickshaw and as a result her family will be able to have a better living standard. This is the second time Parveen has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah. 
 
Note: In the photo, the lady who is raising her hand is Parveen.

loans.use: To buy a new rickshaw

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia A. is from the village of Binuangan, Misamis Oriental. She is 52 years old. Letecia is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Letecia owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Letecia has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Letecia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Letecia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Nadiya

texts.en:
Nadiya is married with two teen age children. She owns a small business selling clothing at Pavlpgrad open market. She started this business 16 years ago. Hard work and entrepreneurial skills helps Nadiya to develop her business. Today it is a family business that has two locations and brings a stable income to Nadiya's family.

Nadiya broke her leg recently. Her family was able to substitute for her and continue the business. Now Nadiya is back and working hard as usual.

This business is very competitive. Nadiya needs to have a good assortment of clothing the clients can choose from. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 UAH to increase assortment of seasonal clothing - coats, sweters, and jackets.

loans.use: to increase the assortment

loans.name: Joemar

texts.en:
Joemar A. is from the village of Kabulawan, Lagonglong, Misamis Oriental. He is 27 years old. Joemar is separated from spouse and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Joemar owns & operates a business venture in the manufacturing sector operating a furniture making business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from making & selling amakan furniture, a bamboo wave forming into a bed sheet  to local businesses and community members. Joemar has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Joemar joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joemar has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. Joemar is requesting a new loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools & other equipment to expand the business. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Joemar from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase tools & other equipment to expand the business

loans.name: Ahtam

texts.ru: Чураев Ахтам проживает в районе Варзоб. Возраст, 51 год. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Образование высшее, инженер. По профессии проработал 5 лет. Сейчас он вместе с женой занимается животноводством и птицеводством. Разводит скот у себя дома. Он в основном откармливает и продает скот. В этой области более 6 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупно - рогатого скота, чтобы увеличить их количество.
texts.en:
Ahtam C. lives in the Varzob district. He is 51 years old, married and has one child. He has a higher education, as an engineer. He worked in that field for 5 years. Currently, together with his wife, Ahtam is involved in animal husbandry and poultry farming. He breeds livestock at home. Ahtam primarily fattens and sells livestock. He has been in this business for over 6 years. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of cattle in order to increase livestock quantity.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cattle

loans.name: Yasmeen's Group

texts.en:
Yasmeen lives in a historic city of Pakistan called Lahore. Lahore is the second largest city of Pakistan and known for its history and culture. 
She is a widow, lost her husband few years ago as a result of heart failure. 
She is the mother of a son who does embroidery works. He couldn’t get an education due to poor financial condition of his family and his parents sent him to embroidery school in his teen age. Now he is an expert in embroidery and operates his business from his home. He has started his own embroider business 8 years ago. 
Yasmeen does sewing. She spends her time in doing sewing for her neighborhood clients. 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah for her son’s business. With the loan amount he will buy embroidery material such as beads, color thread and clothes in bulk quantity to offer his services to larger client base. 
Yasmeen is hopeful with the loan investment her son will be able to expand his business and makes his income double in size. 
She is a regular loan user of Asasah and is in her 5th loan cycle. In previous loan years she never missed any meeting and paid her installments on time. 
Note: “In the photo, a lady who is raising her hand is Yasmeen and the male who is working is her son”.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace B. is a married woman who lives in  Brgy. Nabulao, Sipalay City, Negros Occidental. She operates a balut-making business as one of her main source of income. Her husband Bartolome, who is 45 years old is a farmer but also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 2 teenage children who are still going to school. 

Grace joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 9 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Grace has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15000 which she added to her own capital helped her increase her monthly profit to PHP 25000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 10th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 19000, which she intends to use to buy more duck's eggs which she will incubate to balut, cook and sell in the community so that she could continue to save up for future improvement of business and to send children to school. Grace B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

With the loan amount she will buy clothes in bulk quantity which will help her in increasing her income. texts.en:

Robert's business is located at Thika road, in Nairobi, opposite a busy street where there are many upcoming business premises. He has been selling glass, window panes, paints and other items to the people in and around Nairobi for the last seven years. He says that this business is profitable and the major challenge he has is transportating the glass, which is very delicate and is prone to breakages.

He works very hard to keep his business doing well. He is using his loan of 50,000 KES to buy more tinted glass, wire glass and mirrors to meet the demand of his customers as well as grow his business. He hopes to open other branches in other towns in future and he sees himself becoming a businessman. He describes himself as hardworking, goal oriented and determined.

Her business is located at Mwiki, a fast growing residential area in Nairobi. She sells clothing which includes trousers, shirts, dresses, handbags, shoes and jeans wear. They couldn’t get an education due to financial constraints and the death of their father, and they had to start work at an early age. Anayat’s eldest son is a rickshaw driver while her two younger sons are daily wage laborers. Her daughter does embroidery work. 

Anayat supports her family by selling clothes. She started this business after the death of her husband. She has applied for a loan from the Kiva partner, Asasah, for her elder son. With the loan, he will repair his rickshaw because its engine is creating a problem and won’t allow him to work with it for longer periods of time. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and is in her 4th loan cycle. In the previous loan years she has always paid her installments on time and never missed any meeting.

texts.en:
Olivia N. is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala West region of Uganda.  She is single and has no children. Olivia's business is a retail shop, which she has had for two years.         

To help expand her business, Olivia has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase sugar and maize flour.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Olivia hopes to generate greater profits and to buy more food to sell.  In the future, Olivia hopes to expand her business by making it a wholesale shop. 

Olivia is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by being able to increase her business.

loans.name: Fozil

texts.en:
U. Fozil has always been hard-working man, who has made sure from his young age that his family never goes without their daily bread. He is married with 3 children. 

He has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuff. With a starting capital of $200, and thanks to his perseverance and dedication, Fozil began this enterprise many years ago. Over time he expanded his business and today his whole family is engaged in the business. 

Today Fozil needs to buy additional foodstuff for increasing the range of his selling goods. With this purpose he is requesting a loan of $3,000. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once and awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.     
      
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj
